On 30 April 2025, in Morelia, Michoacan, drivers of digital platforms such as Uber and Didi marched to demand better safety conditions. The event was sparked after a colleague was killed near la Ruana (coded separately).
On 30 April 2025, in Santa Maria Huatulco, Oaxaca, people and former workers of the Tangolunda golf course demonstrated at the offices of the National Commission of Natural Protected Areas (Conanp) demanding that the federal government reopen the space, which they consider vital to the destination's tourism economy.
On 30 April 2025, in Ixhuatlancillo, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, dozens of workers from the municipality protested in the framework of International Labor day and marched to the main entrance to the municipality to demand labor justice and to remember the historical memory of the workers' struggle.
On 30 April 2025, in Minatitlan, Veracruz, workers held a protest at the PEMEX facilities Lazaro Cardenas refinery to demand millions in debt owed to them from the company.
On 30 April 2025, in Mexicali, Baja California, teachers of the Jose Vasconcelos Independent Union of Educational Workers of Baja California (Sietebcjv) held a protest to demand an immediate solution to the lack of their salary payments.
On 30 April 2025, in Ciudad de Mexico - Benito Juarez, around 200 teachers members of the National Coordinator of Education Workers (CNTE) along with administrative workers blocked the main entrance to the Ministry of Public Education (SEP) in Colonia Xoco to demand the dismissal of the Director General of Technological Education, Agriculture, and Marine Sciences (Dgetaycm).
On 30 April 2025, in Torreon, Coahuila, members of the 'Mothers of Power' collective from La Laguna blocked access to the Pronnif (National Pronnif) demanding the payment of the benefits for orphans of femicide to be granted. The protesters demanded justice.
On 30 April 2025, in Cuernavaca, Morelos, women students of the Autonomous University of the State of Morelos (UAEM) held a protest demanding greater attention to the cases of violence against women reported at the university.
On 30 April 2025, in Atasta, Campeche, residents blocked the highway to protest against the lack of electricity.
On 30 April 2025, in Guadalupe, Nuevo Leon, residents held a protest against the construction of the Children's Hospital. The protesters declared that this will affect traffic in the area.
On 30 April 2025, in El Rosario, Sinaloa, people held a protest to demand for the search of a man who is missing since two months.
On 30 April 2025, in Jalpa de Mendez, Tabasco, residents of Mecoacan protested at the Pemex oil refinery, demanding the departure of CTM union representatives. The protesters accused them for monopolizing oil profits. The participants pointed out that the distribution has been inequitable.
On 29 April 2025, in Chalchihuitan, Chiapas, more than a thousand Catholic people marched to demand an end to drug and alcohol sales, and violence against women. The walk was to demand peace.
On 29 April 2025, in Ciudad de Mexico - Alvaro Obregon, around 150 workers from the National Commission for the Continuous Improvement of Education (Mejoredu) held a protest in colonia San Jose Insurgentes against the lack of job security for more than 500 workers.
On 29 April 2025, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, dozens of digital platform delivery drivers held a protest demanding the judges of the Supreme Court of Justice (SCJN) to invalidate the 2% tax that Mexico City charges companies like Uber and DiDi for intermediating in the delivery of food and goods. The protesters stated that this will affect their jobs and also the consumers.
On 29 April 2025, in Cosoleacaque, Veracruz, workers held a protest at the PEMEX facilities to demand millions in debt owed to them from the company.
On 29 April 2025, in Izucar de Matamoros, Puebla, drivers of public transportation blocked the Federal Highway 160 to held a protest against a member of the Route RS3 who invaded their routes.
On 29 April 2025, in Hermosillo, Sonora, for the second day in a row, teachers and members of the Union of Academic Employees of the University of Sonora (STAUS) blocked the intersection of Rosales and Luis Encinas boulevards to demand better labor conditions and higher salaries.
On 29 April 2025, in Chetumal, Quintana Roo, dozens of members of the National Women's Front (FNM) demonstrated in front of the offices of the Attorney General's Office for the Protection of Children, Adolescents, and the Family, demanding an explanation of the procedures for handling backlogged cases. The protesters accused that they had several investigation files for domestic violence that have not progressed. The protesters accused corruption of judges in family custody.
On 29 April 2025, in Ciudad de Mexico - Alvaro Obregon, residents of Las Aguilas area held a protest against the intention of the authorities to build a new Utopia which is a community center promoted by the capital's administration. The residents stated that this is against nature and the construction will led to an environmental damages in the area.
On 29 April 2025, in Saltillo, Coahuila, a group of beneficiaries of the Mexican Social Security Institute (IMSS) protested against the suspension of hemodialysis.
On 29 April 2025, in Chilpancingo de los Bravo, Guerrero, residents of Colonia PRI held a protest to demand water supply.
On 29 April 2025, in Ciudad Nezahualcoyotl, Mexico, a group of residents from Colonia Esperanza blocked the intersection of Chimalhuacan and Tepozanes to protest against the lack of drinking water.
On 28 April 2025, around Delicias, Chihuahua, milk producers blocked the road to Delicias to demand federal support.
On 28 April 2025, in Tepic, Nayarit, farmers from at least 40 ejidos and members of Tepic Irrigation Units Association gathered at the offices of the National Commission of Water to demand projects to support agriculture.
Around 28 April 2025 (as reported), in Oaxaca state (coded to Oaxaca de Juarez), Indigenous communities and relatives of an Ayuuk female activist who disappeared in Oaxaca on 8 October 2024 and whose body was found on 24 April 2025 gathered to commemorate her and demand justice.
On 28 April 2025, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, employees of the Federal Institute of Telecommunications (IFT) protested in front of the Senate and blocked Reforma avenue to demand that their labor rights are guaranteed after the dissolution of the organization.
Around 28 April 2025 (as reported), in Tehuacan, Puebla, recyclers protested in front of the municipal palace to demand facilities that allow them to gather the necessary amount of material that they are demanded to and also to provide them facilities that fulfil the safety measures required by Civil Protection.
Around 28 April 2025 (as reported), in Altamira, Tamaulipas, 10 former employees of Hules Mexicanos public company blocked Industria avenue to demand outstanding compensations for the closure of the company.
On 28 April 2025, in Naucalpan de Juarez, Mexico, activists, lawyers, and relatives and friends of old people who face home evictions marched from Torres de Satelite, on Periferico Norte and to the offices of the Anti-Corruption Prosecutor's Office of the Attorney General's Office of the State of Mexico (FGJEM) on Del Parque avenue to demand justice.
On 28 April 2025, in Gomez Palacio, Durango, 250 municipal police officers from Torreon blocked Periferico Raul Lopez in colonia Amistad, occupied the municipal police premises and marched to Gomez Palacio to demand the dismissal of their superiors due to extortions, corruption, threats, and abuses of authority. This demonstration led to a fight between municipal police officers later the same day (coded separately).
Around 28 April 2025 (as reported), in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, over 200 supporters of Marea Rosa (PRI, PAN and PRD coalition) and the National Civic Front (FCN) protested in front of the Senate against the new Telecommunications Law. The protesters claimed that the government pretended to censor social media.
On 28 April 2025, in Hermosillo, Sonora, around 50 teachers and members of the Union of Academic Employees of the University of Sonora (STAUS) blocked the intersection of Rosales and Luis Encinas boulevards to demand better labor conditions and higher salaries.
On 28 April 2025, in Pachuca de Soto, Hidalgo, the mother and relatives of a child used vehicles to block the intersection of Juarez and Madero avenues and Gomez Perez street, near the Government Palace, to demand that his custody be given to his mother.
On 28 April 2025, in Ciudad Nezahualcoyotl, Mexico, 100 residents blocked Chimalhuacan and Tepozanes avenues to protest against the lack of water supply.
Around 28 April 2025 (as reported), in Francisco I. Madero, Puebla, residents blocked 150 Mexico-Veracruz federal road to demand the municipal authorities to accept the results of the elections for assistant inspector held on 27 April 2025. The protesters claimed that the municipal president intervened to endorse a specific candidate. They also denounced that a group of people acted violently at the polling stations in Tehuacan, which led to the suspension of the voting (coded separately).
On 28 April 2025, in Palmillas (La Columna), Puebla, tens of residents blocked the access to a water well to denounce the lack of water supply.
On 28 April 2025, in Ciudad Madero, Tamaulipas, residents from colonia 16 de Septiembre protested against a construction company due to the impact of its activities in the drainage infrastructure of Comapa Sur.
On 28 April 2025, in Ciudad Madero, Tamaulipas, parents of students of Benito Juarez primary school protested at the school premises in colonia Obrera against the decision of the school supervisor to suspend the special need support and English language programs.
Around 28 April 2025 (as reported), in Nueva Villa de Padilla, Tamaulipas, parents of students of Conrado Castillo primary school, from Ejido Francisco I. Madero, occupied the school premises to demand the dismissal of the director due to his suspected bad management and abuse of authority.
On 28 April 2025, in Tampico, Tamaulipas, activists and relatives of a woman who was killed in February 2025 marched on Obregon avenue and gathered in front of the Specialized Prosecutor's Office for the Investigation of Crimes Against Girls, Boys, and Adolescents and Crimes Against Women for Gender Reasons (FENNAM) to protest against a judge's decision to declare her attacker unaccountable.
On 28 April 2025, in Acultzingo, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, around 100 residents from the community of Coxolitla blocked Acultzingo-Tehuacan federal road by Guadalupe bridge to demand the allocation of five million pesos for public construction works.
On 28 April 2025, in Penuela, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, residents protested in front of the offices of the Water Commission of the State of Veracruz (CAEV) in the intersection of Benito Juarez street and Morelos avenue and blocked the boulevard to Cordoba to demand solutions to the lack of water supply. The protesters also demanded the dismissal of CAEV's director and that the water service be municipalized.
On 28 April 2025, in Huatusco, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, parents of students from the community of Mata Obscura blocked the Totutla-Conejos section of Totutla-Xalapa road to demand the hiring of additional teachers in the local tele-secondary school.
On 28 April 2025, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, tens of relatives of people who had disappeared and members of Sabuesos Guerreros A.C. search group marched from Tres Rios sector to the offices of the State Attorney General's office to demand that they be located. The demonstration was led by between 15 and 20 children in commemoration of the Day of the Child.
On 27 April 2025, in Cacahuatepec, Guerrero, over 250 people, activists, workers, farmers, and teachers associations marched, carried the body and demanded justice for a man who was shot in Playa Icacos on 18 April 2025 and died on 25 April 2025. The victim was the leader of the Council of Ejidos and Communities Opposed to the La Parota Dam (Cecop).
Around 27 April 2025 (as reported), in Xalapa-Enriquez, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, members of the National Front of Bakers protested in Lerdo Square to denounce that their state leader did not respect the front's regulations to nominate candidates for the next local elections and sold the candidacies.
On 27 April 2025, in Heroica Puebla de Zaragoza, Puebla, over 5,000 members of the Republican Trade Union Confederation of Puebla and workers of the transport, construction, automotive, gas, and food industries marched from Paseo Bravo to the zocalo to commemorate the International Workers' Day and demand better labor conditions. The march was attended by the state Secretary of Economy and Labor.
On 27 April 2025, in the municipality of Iguala de la Independencia, Guerrero, normalista students of Rural Raal Isidro Burgos school, activists, and teachers of Guerrero State Coordinating Committee of Education Workers (CETEG) protested to demand justice for the 43 normalistas from Ayotzinapa who disappeared in 2014. The demonstrators also demanded justice for the leader of the Council of Ejidos and Communities Opposed to the La Parota Dam (Cecop), who was killed in Playa Icacos on 18 April 2025.
On 27 April 2025, in Guadalupe, Nuevo Leon, around 40 residents gathered on Paseo de las Americas avenue by Capullos DIF to demand information on the environmental and traffic impact of the construction of a new children hospital in the area.
On 27 April 2025, in Nogales, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, relatives and friends of a man who disappeared on 21 April 2025 marched from the municipal palace of Mendoza to Nogales, where they blocked Orizaba-Mendoza highway, to demand the authorities to locate him.
Around 27 April 2025 (as reported), in Huauchinango, Puebla, members of the Mexican Electrical Workers Union (SME) gathered at the zocalo to demand a meeting with the President of the Senate, who was there to attend a conference about the judicial elections. The protesters demanded a solution to the problems caused by a cryptocurrency farm that was installed in the area and connected to the power network of the SNE offices, but a group of unidentified men arrived at the scene, beat them and took their banner away. According to the demonstrators, the men were sent by a local senator who intended to prevent them from reaching the President.
On 26 April 2025, in Chalchihuitan, Chiapas, hundreds of Catholic and Indigenous women marched from the entrance to the town to San Pablo church to demand the closure of bars and measures against the consumption of alcohol and drugs.
Around 26 April 2025 (as reported), in Chihuahua, Chihuahua, transport drivers and members of the National Confederation of Mexican Transport Drivers (Conatram) parked their vehicles in front of the offices of the Federal Attorney General on Universidad avenue to protest against extortions and demand the release of three of their members, who were arrested and accused of fuel thieving.
On 26 April 2025, in Guadalajara, Jalisco, 100 street vendors blocked the intersection of Federalismo and Juarez avenues and gathered outside the city hall to protest against the impact of the remodeling works in the Rojo/Revolucion park, which prevents them from holding their Saturday market. According to the demonstrators, the area that the authorities have offered them to resettle in was insufficient.
On 26 April 2025, in the municipality of San Fernando, Tamaulipas, dealers of cars made in the US (known as 'carreros') used tires and vehicles to block km. 201 of Victoria-Matamoros federal road, in front of the National Guard premises and the area known as 'La Y', by Colonia Rural, to denounce extortion carried out by the officers.
On 26 April 2025, in Chilpancingo de los Bravo, Guerrero, normalista students from Ayotzinapa and members of Lupita Rodriguez Narciso search group protested at the Anti-Monument to the 43 on Las Banderas boulevard to denounce the lack of progress in the investigation into the disappearance of 43 normalistas in 2014.
Around 26 April 2025 (as reported), in Aguascalientes, Aguascalientes, a group of men protested to demand judicial processes that allow them to see their children during family justice proceedings and protection against false allegations of gender violence. Similar demonstrations took place in Nuevo Leon, Mexico, Morelos and Colima states (coded separately).
On 26 April 2025, in Ciudad de Mexico, relatives and friends of a child who died in a children military camp due protested to demand justice claiming that the child's death was caused by injuries inflicted by his monitors and the camp's harsh conditions.
Around 26 April 2025 (as reported), in Colima, Colima, a group of men protested to demand judicial processes that allow them to see their children during family justice proceedings and protection against false allegations of gender violence. Similar demonstrations took place in Nuevo Leon, Mexico, Aguascalientes and Morelos states (coded separately).
Around 26 April 2025 (as reported), in Pachuca de Soto, Hidalgo, relatives of a woman who disappeared in August 2016 and whose body was found in January 2017 marched along with his coffin to the offices of the Attorney General of the State of Hidalgo (PGJEH) to demand justice. The demonstrators denounced that two former prosecutors hindered the investigations.
Around 26 April 2025 (as reported), in Mexico state (coded to Toluca de Lerdo), a group of men protested to demand judicial processes that allow them to see their children during family justice proceedings and protection against false allegations of gender violence. Similar demonstrations took place in Nuevo Leon, Morelos, Aguascalientes and Colima states (coded separately).
Around 26 April 2025 (as reported), in Morelos state (coded to Cuernavaca), a group of men and members of 'No More Hostage Children in Morelos' protested to demand judicial processes that allow them to see their children during family justice proceedings and protection against false allegations of gender violence. Similar demonstrations took place in Nuevo Leon, Mexico, Aguascalientes and Colima states (coded separately).
Around 26 April 2025 (as reported), in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, a group of men protested to demand judicial processes that allow them to see their children during family justice proceedings and protection against false allegations of gender violence. Similar demonstrations took place in Morelos, Mexico, Aguascalientes and Colima states (coded separately).
On 26 April 2025, in Heroica Puebla de Zaragoza, Puebla, hundreds of members of UPVA 28 de Octubre organization marched from Paseo Bravo to Reforma avenue, the zocalo, Casa Aguayo and San Francisco Temple to demand the release of a transport driver who was arrested at the offices of the state Secretariat of Transport earlier this week. The arrestee is suspectedly linked to a murder of a bus driver in San Andres Azumiatla in March 2025. The demonstrators also denounced that their leadership had received life treats.
On 26 April 2025, in Ciudad Victoria, Tamaulipas, relatives and friends of a child who was run over and died protested in front of Paqueteria Castores company to demand justice. According to the demonstrators, an employee of the company was the one who ran over the victim, retained him while he was injured, and contacted the family to offer them money.
On 25 April 2025, in Tuxtla Gutierrez, Chiapas, relatives of members of the Mexican Army and the National Guard held a protest and marched to promote support for imprisoned military personnel and fallen soldiers. The event was in support of four soldiers imprisoned for their participation in the killing of five civilians in Nuevo Laredo, Tamaulipas, in 2023. This event was replicated in other locations (coded separately).
On 25 April 2025, in Ciudad de Mexico - Coyoacan, hundreds of students marched toward the General Rector's Office at Ciudad Universitaria to demand a meeting with school authorities and to be respected. The incident erupted after the school had to repeal its Facility Safety Instructions, as the measures triggered student's protests.
On 25 April 2025, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, relatives of members of the Mexican Army and the National Guard held a protest and marched to promote support for imprisoned military personnel and fallen soldiers. The protesters blocked Eje Central Avenue and marched from the Angel de la Independencia to demand justice and legal protection. Among the participants there were members of the collective ' We Are All One, Mexican Army We Are All'. The event was in support of four soldiers imprisoned for their participation in the killing of five civilians in Nuevo Laredo, Tamaulipas, in 2023. This event was replicated in other locations (coded separately).
On 25 April 2025, in Colima, Colima, retired Pemex workers protested against the lack of healthcare services that were suspended a month ago.
On 25 April 2025, in Guanajuato, Guanajuato, relatives of members of the Mexican Army and the National Guard held a protest and marched to promote support for imprisoned military personnel and fallen soldiers. The event was in support of four soldiers imprisoned for their participation in the killing of five civilians in Nuevo Laredo, Tamaulipas, in 2023. This event was replicated in other locations (coded separately).
On 25 April 2025, in Irapuato, Guanajuato, relatives of members of the Mexican Army and the National Guard held a protest in front of the XII Military Region to promote support for imprisoned military personnel and fallen soldiers. The event was in support of four soldiers imprisoned for their participation in the killing of five civilians in Nuevo Laredo, Tamaulipas, in 2023. This event was replicated in other locations (coded separately).
On 25 April 2025, in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, students of the Raul Isidro Burgos Rural Teachers' College in Ayotzinapa held a rally on Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman to demand justice for the 43 classmates who disappeared in Iguala. The protesters also demanded the dismissal of the head of the Secretariat of Public Security and Citizen Protection (SSPC).
On 25 April 2025, in Pachuca de Soto, Hidalgo, family members and activists demonstrated in front of the Attorney General's Office of the State of Hidalgo (PGJEH) to demand justice for the killing of a woman eight years ago. The protesters demanded justice.
On 25 April 2025, in Los Reyes Acaquilpan, Mexico, around 50 vendors blocked the Mexico-Texcoco federal highway to protest against their inability to set up their stalls on the streets in the main square. The event was sparked after the vendors were removed from the street since last February.
On 25 April 2025, in Mexico state (coded to Toluca de Lerdo), relatives of members of the Mexican Army and the National Guard held a protest and marched to promote support for imprisoned military personnel and fallen soldiers. The event was in support of four soldiers imprisoned for their participation in the killing of five civilians in Nuevo Laredo, Tamaulipas, in 2023. This event was replicated in other locations (coded separately).
On 25 April 2025, in Tancitaro, Michoacan, residents blocked access to the municipality to prevent military forces from disarming members of a self-defense group. The demonstrators who confronted the military (methods unknown) denounced that they do not have the presence of criminal groups and have security because the self-defense groups are armed.
On 25 April 2025, in Xicotepec de Juarez, Puebla, relatives of members of the Mexican Army and the National Guard held a protest and marched to promote support for imprisoned military personnel and fallen soldiers. The event was in support of four soldiers imprisoned for their participation in the killing of five civilians in Nuevo Laredo, Tamaulipas, in 2023. This event was replicated in other locations (coded separately).
On 25 April 2025, in San Luis Potosi, San Luis Potosi, relatives of members of the Mexican Army and the National Guard held a protest and marched to promote support for imprisoned military personnel and fallen soldiers. The event was in support of four soldiers imprisoned for their participation in the killing of five civilians in Nuevo Laredo, Tamaulipas, in 2023. This event was replicated in other locations (coded separately).
On 25 April 2025, in Mazatlan, Sinaloa, a group of people defrauded by the developer of the Universal real estate group demonstrated to demand justice and denounce the slowness with which the criminal proceedings initiated in this regard are being carried out.
On 25 April 2025, in Ciudad Victoria, Tamaulipas, a hundred farmers protested in front of the offices of the Agrarian Court to demand attention from the authorities over their cases.
On 25 April 2025, in Ciudad Mendoza, Veracruz, family, friends, and bikers held a protest at the city center to demand the immediate return of a young man who was reported missing since last 21 April.
On 25 April 2025, in Xalapa-Enriquez, Veracruz, a mother who cares for a child with disabilities along with her two sons demonstrated at the state Congress to demand recognition and attention for those who perform care work.
On 25 April 2025, in Cuernavaca, Morelos, more than 100 drivers of app driving services blocked three major traffic points in the city to demand to the Governor the immediately search of a colleague who disappeared in Jiutepec on 18 April 2025. The protesters also asked for greater security. The roadblocks were set on Paloma de la Paz boulevard, Plan de Ayala avenue by the offices of the Federal Attorney General and the IMSS General Hospital, and Mexico-Cuernavaca federal road in front of GS Hotel.
On 25 April 2025, in Villahermosa, Tabasco, judges and employees of the Judiciary protested at a conference about the judicial reform attended by a candidate for Minister of the Supreme Court of Justice of the Nation (SCJN) at Tabasco Inn Hotel. The demonstrators demanded the minister to leave.
On 24 April 2025, in Tijuana, Baja California, a group of residents of Fraccionamiento Residencial Playas Diamante demonstrated to prevent the removal of the security booth located at the entrance to the condominiums.
On 24 April 2025, in Tuxtla Gutierrez, Chiapas, more than 60 Venezuelan migrants held a protest and demanded humanitarian flights outside the INM. The migrants asked to be returned to their country with the support of President Claudia Sheinbaum.
On 24 April 2025, in Ciudad de Mexico - Alvaro Obregon, around 30 people who saved their money at the Microentrepreneur Assistance Council (Came) held a protest at the National Banking and Securities Commission (CNBV) demanding answers and the return of their funds after the company has not publish their data since few months and changed of address without warning their users.
On 24 April 2025, in Teoloyucan, Mexico, residents along with the mayor (Morena party) gathered at the toll booth on the Mexico-Queretaro highway to demand that the National Water Commission (Conagua) and the State of Mexico Water Commission (Caem) provide water service in their district. Also, tens of residents blocked the roads leading to Tepotzotlan, Melchor Ocampo, Cuautitlan and Coyotepec to demand also water service.
On 24 April 2025, in San Francisco Pichataro, Michoacan, residents blocked the access to the town and other nearby roads after two community security officers were killed in an ambush a day before on the Pichataro-Sevina stretch (coded separately). The residents prevented the access to their community.
On 24 April 2025, in Heroica Zitacuaro, Michoacan, residents blocked the Zitacuaro-Morelia highway near the San Felipe pedestrian bridge to protest against the assembly to elect the federal budget committee FAISPIAM (Social Infrastructure Contribution Fund). The protesters stated that the Ministry of Welfare staff did not respect the decision of the majority during the community committee selection process.
On 24 April 2025, in Salina Cruz, Oaxaca, business owners affiliated with the Mexican Chamber of the Construction Industry (Cmic) marched to demand that Petroleos Mexicanos (Pemex) pays them the more than one billion pesos the company owes them.
On 24 April 2025, in San Andres Cholula, Puebla, farmers from Malacatepec and Zacatepec, as well as members of the Union of Subdivisions Against the Cholula Landfill and the Indigenous Peoples of Cholula in Resistance, gathered at the entrance to the courthouse to demand justice and the release of a colleague who was accused of sexual abuse.
On 24 April 2025, in Tecualilla, Sinaloa, land owners held a protest to demand outstanding payments for damages from canal works at the Santa Maria Dam.
On 23 April 2025, in Tapachula de Cordova y Ordonez, Chiapas, activists and migrants of Central and South American nationalities protested at the premises of Siglo XXI Migratory Station to demand more resources, the end of criminalization of migrants and to reject the migration policies of the United States.
On 23 April 2025, in Ciudad de Mexico - Alvaro Obregon, employees of the National Commission for the Continuous Improvement of Education (Mejoredu) blocked Insurgentes Sur avenue by Barranca del Muerto, in Colonia Guadalupoe Inn, to demand labor guarantees, following the government's decision to extinguish the organization.
On 23 April 2025, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, members of Daughters of Cannabis association blocked Juarez avenue in front of Alameda Central to demand the release of two of their members, who were arrested on 22 April 2025 for unknown reasons. The protesters also demanded the end to the criminalization of cannabis consumption and cultivation.
On 23 April 2025, in Colima, Colima, residents of Colonias Tulipanes, Las Presas and Verde Valle protested in the premises of the Intermunicipal Commission of Drinking Water and Sewerage of Colima and Villa de Alvarez (CIAPACOV) to demand measures to improve the quality of the water supply.
Around 23 April 2025 (as reported), in Apaseo el Grande, Guanajuato, members of the LGBTQ+ community and relatives and friends of two men who were killed (coded separately) marched from the entrance of the town to the town hall to demand justice and denounce that the municipal authorities did not intervene to prevent these crimes.
On 23 April 2025, in the municipality of Emiliano Zapata, Hidalgo, transport drivers and members of the Cement Union blocked the accesses to Times Ceramics company to demand outstanding payments.
On 23 April 2025, in Tizayuca, Hidalgo, at least 12 residents of Fraccionamiento Villa Los Milagros used stones, tires and other objects to block Mexico-Pachuca highway by Flamingo's spa to demand the restoration of the water supply.
On 23 April 2025, in Chimalhuacan, Mexico, residents of Colonia San Agustin used tires and stones to block Los Rosales bridge to denounce the lack of water supply since three months ago.
Around 23 April 2025 (as reported), in Tepotzotlan, Mexico, cargo and passenger drivers and members of the Union of Owners of Tourist, Passenger and Cargo Buses AC (UPAC) blocked traffic at the toll of Mexico-Queretaro highway to demand measures against insecurity, abuse of authority, corruption, high costs of tolls and the poor conditions of roads.
On 23 April 2025, in Charo, Michoacan de Ocampo, Civil Guard officers protested at Lic. David Franco Rodriguez Penitentiary Center to demand higher salaries and better labor conditions. Simultaneous demonstrations took place in other locations of Michoacan state (coded separately).
On 23 April 2025, in Ciudad Lazaro Cardenas, Michoacan de Ocampo, Civil Guard officers protested to demand higher salaries and better labor conditions. Simultaneous demonstrations took place in other locations of Michoacan state (coded separately).
On 23 April 2025, in Morelia, Michoacan de Ocampo, Civil Guard officers protested at the Secretariat of Security on Libramiento avenue and at Valladolid Barracks to demand higher salaries and better labor conditions. Simultaneous demonstrations took place in other locations of Michoacan state (coded separately).
On 23 April 2025, in Uruapan, Michoacan de Ocampo, Civil Guard officers protested at their regional headquarters to demand higher salaries and better labor conditions. The protest was attended by a former congresswoman. Simultaneous demonstrations took place in other locations of Michoacan state (coded separately).
On 23 April 2025, in Heroica Puebla de Zaragoza, Puebla, around 400 farmers from Huejotzingo and San Salvador El Seco entered the offices of Angelopolis Tax Administration Service (SAT) on Via Atlixcayotl and pushed and retained a female employee to demand the return of the Special Tax on Production and Services (IEPS). During the event, the protesters threw bottles of water at state police officers who arrived at the scene, and the officers threw them back at the protesters. According to a source, the protesters were carrying out sticks and machetes and destroyed the facilities of the Tax Administration Service (SAT). It is unknown whether there were injured.
On 23 April 2025, in Mazatlan, Sinaloa, tens of people and construction workers protested outside a house on Cruz Lizarraga avenue, in Colonia Ferrocarrilera to denounce that the U.S. owner of the house discriminated a Mexican construction worker. Alternative versions indicated that it was in Colonia Palos Prietos or Fraccionamiento Tellerias. The worker was suspectedly having lunch next to the house when the owner demanded him to leave. The incident was recorded on video and posted on social media, accusing the homeowner of racism. During the event, demonstrators kicked the door of the house and threw food at it. State police officers struggled with the protesters, dissolved the demonstration (methods unknown) and arrested a person for blocking traffic and altering public order.
On 23 April 2025, in Merida, Yucatan, residents of Tahdzibichen protested at the municipal palace to demand the mayor to guarantee their property right over their land. The demonstrators claimed that they bought it but have not yet received their property titles.
Around 22 April 2025 (as reported), in Creel, Chihuahua, Raramuri from the community of Bosques de San Elias Repechique protested near the regional airport to demand the Federal Attorney for Environmental Protection (Profepa) and the state government to take measures to stop illegal logging in their territory.
Around 22 April 2025 (as reported), in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, around 100 young athletes and their relatives blocked Paseo de la Reforma avenue by the central offices of the Social Security Institute (IMSS) to denounce that the authorities did not consider them in selections for national tournaments.
On 22 April 2025, in Ciudad de Mexico - Miguel Hidalgo, members of Indigenous organizations and collectives of human rights defenders demonstrated in front of the National Museum of Anthropology against the so-called Interoceanic Corridor of the Isthmus (CIIT). Among the protestors, there were Ayuujk indigenous people (coded to Mixtec Indigenous Group) and Biniza indigenous people(coded to Zapotec Indigenous Group) from Mogone Viejo and Rincon Viejo. The protestors demanded justice for 24 farmers (three of them members of the Union of Indigenous Communities of the North Zone) from San Juan Guichicovi and Matias Romero who face judicial processes for actions to defend their land.
Around 22 April 2025 (as reported), in Singuilucan, Hidalgo, former employees of the town hall protested to denounce that the current mayor asked them for their vote in exchange for resolving a labor dispute over the payment of outstanding wages since 2016, which had not been resolved.
On 22 April 2025, in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, around 30 members of The Voice of the Users blocked traffic around the Palace of Justice to demand the release of one of their members, who was arrested during a demonstration on 19 April 2025 (coded separately). The protesters blocked Rodrigo Gomez, Fidel Velazquez and Palacio de Justice avenues.
Around 22 April 2025 (as reported), in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, residents and a federal congresswoman of the Citizen's Movement party protested outside the municipal palace against the reform of urban planning regulations that would eliminate the need of an environmental impact study for new constructions.
On 22 April 2025, in Heroica Puebla de Zaragoza, Puebla, people who work as clowns and members of Urban Clown association protested at the zocalo to demand to be allowed to work in the area.
On 22 April 2025, in Tehuacan, Puebla, owners of recycling plants marched to the town hall to demand the municipal authorities more flexibility and a longer period for the delivery of the necessary permits to operate, after four of the plants were ordered to suspend their activities.
On 22 April 2025, in Hermosillo, Sonora, relatives of a baby who died during childbirth at the Integral Hospital of Women (HIMES) protested outside the government palace to demand justice. The demonstrator claimed that the doctors refused to perform a cesarean section twice due to the lack of available beds at the hospital.
On 22 April 2025, in Xalapa-Enriquez, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, residents blocked the Lazaro Cardenas avenue, in Colonia Rafael Lucio, to protest against the construction of a municipal police base and a parking lot in a field that was meant to host cultural and sport premises.
On 21 April 2025, in Chihuahua, Chihuahua, relatives of a victim of child abuse protested outside the government palace to demand justice in the handling of the case and the review of the case for a fair sentence.
On 21 April 2025, in Ciudad de Mexico - Azcapotzalco, students of the Autonomous Metropolitan University (UAM) took over campus facilities and initiated an indefinite strike to demand a response from campus authorities to their requests, such as solutions to poor infrastructure, addressing gender-based violence and mental health.
Around 21 April 2025 (as reported), in Ciudad de Mexico - Coyoacan, students of the College of Sciences and Humanities (CCH) South protested and blocked several roads to denounce the sexual assault of a student with autism and against UNAM authorities who are accused of failing to address the case.
On 21 April 2025, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, activists and collectives protested a the Paseo de la Reforma and at the former headquarters of the Attorney General's Office (FGR) against disappearances in Mexico City and the country and painted graffiti as part of the National Day of Searching families.
On 21 April 2025, in Leon de los Aldama, Guanajuato, nearly 150 street vendors protested and blocked the avenue Miguel Aleman to demand their right to work at the place they were evicted from. The vendors were left without income during a reorganization operation implemented by authorities.
On 21 April 2025, in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, about 30 residents of Colonia Las Cruces protested outside the Acapulco Municipal Water and Sewer Commission (Capama) pumping station to demand access to running water in their homes.
On 21 April 2025, in Tulancingo, Hidalgo, farmers from the states of Mexico, Tlaxcala and Hidalgo used tires and cans to block the tolls on km. 153 of Arco Norte highway, by the exit to Mexico-Tuxpan highway. The demonstration continued until at least 22 April 2025. The protesters demanded outstanding compensations for the expropriation of their lands for the construction of the highway. According to affected drivers, the demonstrators suspectedly demanded payment of 50 pesos to be allowed to pass.
On 21 April 2025, in Huejotzingo, Puebla, residents of the teachers' housing unit protested during a visit by the mayor to demand solutions to water shortages and to demand increased police presence to guarantee safety in the area.
On 21 April 2025, in Heroica Puebla de Zaragoza, Puebla, nearly 30 relatives of a missing minor protested at the Zocalo to demand the expedition of the search of the missing boy.
On 20 April 2025, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, thousands of people protested to demand spaces to consume marihuana as part of World Marihuana Day and against the illegal possession and consumption of marihuana.
On 20 April 2025, in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, relatives and colleagues of a man who was shot a day before protested to denounce the attack and to demand justice for the attack.
On 20 April 2025, in Toluca de Lerdo, Mexico, hundreds of people protested to demand an end to the criminalization of marihuana and to demand its legalization.
On 20 April 2025, in San Nicolas de los Garza, Nuevo Leon, about 40 residents of Colonia Lomas del Roble protested to demand dialogue with representatives of the Zinc Nacional company and an end of its operations in the sector.
On 20 April 2025, in Palmas de Abajo, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, environmentalists protested at a chicken farm to denounce the pollution caused to the El Coyolito river and the surrounding La Mancha lagoon.
On 20 April 2025, in Orizaba, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, residents protested to denounce excessive charges by the Federal Electricity Commission (CFE) outside the company's office.
On 20 April 2025, in Orizaba, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, skaters protested outside the municipal palace to demand the mayor to fulfill his promise of a skate park during campaigns.
On 19 April 2025, in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, at least 15 relatives of a patient at Clinic 33 protested and temporarily blocked roads to denounce medical negligence and lack of medication.
On 19 April 2025, in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, between 30 and 40 people demonstrated in the center of the city against the fare increase of public transportation and moved to the Government Palace. When the protesters tried to enter the Government Palace, the Civil Force police prevented them from doing so, initiating a scuffle in which there were blows and insults. Riot police used fire extinguishers to control the protesters. Some of the protesters painted graffiti and threw water and objects (unspecified) at the police. One man was arrested accused of physically assaulting four police officers and damaging the government building.
On 19 April 2025, in Cancun, Quintana Roo, one dozen searching mothers protested and placed cards with the pictures of their missing relatives and demanded progress into investigations of missing persons outside the municipal government.
On 18 April 2025, in Ciudad Madero, Tamaulipas, residents of Fraccionamiento Miramar Sector 2 blocked the accesses to Miramar beach to demand the Federal Commission of Electricy (CFE) a solution for power outages in the area.
Around 17 April 2025 (as reported), in Guadalajara, Jalisco, 30 members of the Union of Revolutionary Youth of Mexico (UJRM) and the indigenous community of Colonia Sergio Barrios marched from Agua Azul park to the government palace to demand the right to housing and juridic guaranties for the community, who currently occupies a building that belongs to the state government but remains to be officially transferred.
On 17 April 2025, in Ciudad de Mexico - Coyoacan, employees of Casa Cuna daycare center and members of Social Assistance Center for Early Childhood (CASPI) used signs of pieces of wood to block Calzada Tlalpan to protest against the dismissal of five female employees and to demand better labor conditions and more resources.
On 17 April 2025, in Chilpancingo de los Bravo, Guerrero, for the second consecutive day, residents of Colonia PRD blocked Chilpancingo-Amojileca road to demand the restoration of water supply. The demonstrators also seized six water extraction pipes that supposedly transport water to other colonies.
On 17 April 2025, in Santo Tomas, Michoacan de Ocampo, members of the local indigenous community blocked Morelia-Zamora road to demand the authorities to locate a man who had suspectedly been abducted the day before. According to the man's wife, unidentified individuals on a motorcycle had abducted him from their house. The man returned to his house under the influence of alcohol and confirmed that he had not been abducted, after which the protesters removed the blockade.
On 17 April 2025, near Oaxaca de Juarez, Oaxaca, bus drivers and members of United Transport Drivers of Oaxaca blocked Barranca Larga-Ventanilla highway, which connects the state capital and Puerto Escondido. The demonstrators allowed traffic but prevented the passage of buses from the ADO company, which they accuse of benefiting from excessive concessions to gain a monopoly on the use of the highway. State police officers arrived at the scene, dispersed the protesters and arrested an unspecified number of them (methods unknown).
On 17 April 2025, in Zacatecas, Zacatecas, employees of ZigZag Interactive Center occupied the premises to demand outstanding payments.
On 17 April 2025, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, seven members of a Catholic group protested outside the Museum of Ciudad de Mexico against an art exhibition depicting cardinals and nuns in erotic positions.
On 17 April 2025, in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, tens of search activists (the majority of them, women) marched from the Metropolitan Cathedral to six other Christian churches to demand more support from society and the authorities. The churches included in the march were Dulces Nombres, Sagrado Corazon, Roble, San Jose, Perpetuo Socorro and Dolores.
On 16 April 2025, in Aguascalientes, Aguascalientes, around 2,000 workers of the horse riding, bull fighting and cock fighting industries, taxi drivers, municipal and state employees and citizens marched along Francisco I. Madero avenue to Patria Square and the state congress to demand that such activities be considered as traditions and essential parts of San Marcos National Fair. The march was also attended by the city mayor of the Citizens' Movement party, a federal congressman of the PAN party and a former mayor and former local congressman of the PRI party.
On 16 April 2025, in Ciudad de Mexico, around 30 cleaning workers of Shiny Place company blocked Constituyentes avenue and the accesses to the National Guard offices where they work to demand higher salaries.
Around 16 April 2025 (as reported), in Tijuana, Baja California, victims of a man who was arrested in Nayarit on 11 April 2023 on charges of pederasty and human trafficking protested to demand progress in the judicial process.
On 16 April 2025, in Tijuana, Baja California, mothers of children with autism, members of United Families for Autism and employees of the Integral Rehabilitation Center (CRI), including medical workers, protested on Del Rio Avenue to demand that the governor provide more resources to operate autism care centers and better labor conditions.
Around 16 April 2025 (as reported), in Ciudad de Mexico - Iztacalco, trans people and members of Lleca association protested outside Ciudad de Mexico Housing Institute to demand decent housing, rental facilities and shelters in better conditions.
Around 16 April 2025 (as reported), in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, residents blocked Amistad street, in Colonia Universal, to protest against the suspension of the drainage replacement works.
On 16 April 2025, in Chilpancingo de los Bravo, Guerrero, residents of Colonia PRD blocked Chilpancingo-Amojileca road to demand the restoration of water supply.
On 16 April 2025, in Guadalajara, Jalisco, relatives and friends of a man who disappeared in Tonala on 12 April 2025 marched from The Boulevard of the Missing Ones to Casa Jalisco to demand the state government to locate him.
On 16 April 2025, near San Francisco Pichataro, Michoacan de Ocampo, indigenous normalista students, farmers and relatives of a student of Rural Vasco de Quiroga school who disappeared in Tiripetio on 13 April 2025 blocked an unspecified road to the community to demand that he be located. The student's body was found in Lagunillas on 18 April 2025 (coded separately).
Around 16 April 2025 (as reported), in Coajomulco, Morelos, farmers blocked Mexico-Cuernavaca highway during five hours to demand the authorities to intervene against a wildfire in Las Palomas.
On 16 April 2025, in Santo Domingo Atoyatempan, Puebla, employees of the city hall blocked their offices to demand the suspension of the Secretary General due to irregularities in her work.
On 16 April 2025, in San Luis Potosi, San Luis Potosi, relatives of two children who were suspectedly abducted by members of their families marched from Juan Sarabia avenue to the premises of the State Attorney General on Eje Vial and the government palace to demand the authorities to intervene and locate them.
Around 16 April 2025 (as reported), in Orizaba, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, members of the Popular Revolutionary Front (FPR), the National Front for Socialism (FNLS) and the Front of Revolutionary Action simulated a crucifixion in front of the premises of the Federal Commission of Electricity (CFE) to denounce the excessive bills charged to a woman in Rio Blanco.
Around 16 April 2025 (as reported), in Xalapa-Enriquez, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, residents of Sierra Alta, in the municipality of Coatepec, protested in front of the government palace in Sebastian Lerdo de Tejada square against their eviction, which took place on 21 February 2025 (uncoded). The protesters denounced that the eviction was carried out violently.
On 16 April 2025, in Leon de los Aldama, Guanajuato, around 60 street vendors blocked Miguel Aleman avenue and protested outside the municipal palace against the prohibition of working in the area.
On 16 April 2025, in Tatahuicapan, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, several material transport drivers protested at the municipal palace to demand outstanding payments. During the demonstration, the mayor tried to snatch the cell phone from a journalist who was covering the protest and ordered the police to remove him, which was prevented by the demonstrators (methods unknown).
On 16 April 2025, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, employees of the State Commission of Human Rights and relatives and friends of a woman who disappeared on 5 April 2025 marched from the cathedral and on Alvaro Obregon avenue to La Lomita to demand the authorities to locate her.
On 15 April 2025, in San Cristobal de las Casas, Chiapas, nearly 200 people from Cuxtitali El Pinar Ejido held a protest at the Municipal Administrative Unit to refute accusations against them. The event was sparked after residents from Cuxtitali accused the protesters to be responsible for their lack of water service.
On 15 April 2025, in Morelia, Michoacan de Ocampo, indigenous normalista students, farmers and relatives of a student of Rural Vasco de Quiroga school who disappeared in Tiripetio on 13 April 2025 used a bus and a trailer to block Calzada la Huerta by Colonia Xangari to demand that he be located. Additional demonstrations took place in Zirahuen and Santa Maria Huiramangaro (coded separately). The student's body was found in Lagunillas on 18 April 2025 (coded separately).
On 15 April 2025, in Zirahuen, Michoacan de Ocampo, indigenous normalista students, farmers and relatives of a student of Rural Vasco de Quiroga school who disappeared in Tiripetio on 13 April 2025 blocked Siglo 21 highway by the toll to demand that he be located. The demonstrators removed the roadblock on 16 April 2025. Additional demonstrations took place in Morelia and Santa Maria Huiramangaro (coded separately). The student's body was found in Lagunillas on 18 April 2025 (coded separately).
