Members of the Veracruz Teachers' Democratic movement (MDMV) affiliated with the CNTE joined protests to reject the 2007 reform to the ISSSTE law.
On 1 May 2025, in Lerdo, Durango, representatives of labor unions protested in the framework of International Labor Day and as part of a ceremony, the municipal education department marked the 139th anniversary of labor day to reflect on human rights in the workplace.
On 1 May 2025, in Mexicali, Baja California, teachers, health workers, bureaucrats and different groups protested in the framework of International Labor day to demand better working conditions, pay for interim and retired teachers and labor justice, among other.
On 1 May 2025, in Poza Rica de Hidalgo, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, more than 3000 workers of 14 unions joined protests in the framework of International Labor day. Employees from the health and education sector demanded better working conditions as part of the protest.
On 1 May 2025, in Merida, Yucatan, more than 300 workers from several unions, including workers from the health sector, education, agricultural sectors, sex workers, and activist groups protested in the downtown area to the Government Palace to demand improvements to their labor conditions and respect for their labor rights in the framework of International Labor Day.
On 1 May 2025, in Misantla, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, workers, union members, merchants and service providers joined protests in the framework of International Labor day to demand labor justice and to respect labor. The protest was led by the City Council and joined by teachers of the SNTE section 56 and 32.
On 1 May 2025, in Chihuahua, Chihuahua, 22,000 teachers and members of the SNTE section 42 and section 8 protested and marched to the Government Palace to demand respect for their labor rights, compliance with union rules and improvements to the State Civil Pension service.
On 1 May 2025, in Colima, Colima, teachers and members of the SNTE protested in the framework of International Labor day to demand fair working conditions, decent wages, quality medical services as well as access to decent and fair retirement.
On 1 May 2025, in Pachuca de Soto, Hidalgo, more than 53,000 retired and active teachers and administrative staff and members of the SNTE joined protests in the framework of International Labor Day to demand labor justice and to address salary increase and the modifications to the Teachers' Career System Unit.
On 1 May 2025, in Gomez Palacio, Durango, approximately 6000 people, teachers, members of the SNTE section 35 together with the Workers, Peasants, Students, and People's Front (FOCEP), the National Coordinator of Education Workers (CNTE), the Authentic Labor Front, the Workers' Popular Coordinating Council (COCOPO) protested in the framework of International Labor Day to demand the government to address pending payments to teachers and to denounce the poor services offered by the ISSSTE and lack of sufficient medicine at hospitals as well as a 15% salary increase.
On 1 May 2025, in Morelia, Michoacan de Ocampo, several unions participated in the protest in the framework of International Labor day to demand benefit payments, salary levelling and other work related topics. The protest was joined by teachers affiliated with the CNTE, the SNTE, the Civic Social Front, the SNTSA, the Michoacan University Professors' Union (SPUM), the Michoacan State Workers' Association (ATEM) and the Michoacan University Workers' Union (STUMICH).
On 1 May 2025, in Chilpancingo de los Bravo, Guerrero, approximately 7000 teachers and members of the SNTE section 14 protested and marched to the Government palace to commemorate International Labor day and to demand the government to fulfil all agreements. Union organizations, state government employees, staff from the State Institute for youth and adult education, employees of the institution's Comprehensive Family Development System and members of the State's highway and airport infrastructure commission joined the protests.
On 1 May 2025, in Tuxtla Gutierrez, Chiapas, members of the SNTSA section 50 protested in the framework of International Labor day to demand an increase in resources, access to running water, bathrooms among other.
On 1 May 2025, in Atlixco, Puebla, telephone workers and members of the STRM protested in the framework of International Labor day to demand their petitions to be addressed that include the strengthening of the collective bargaining agreement, respect for labor rights, and the need to maintain a permanent dialogue between workers, the federal government, state governments, and legislative branches.
On 1 May 2025, in Izucar de Matamoros, Puebla, members of the STRM protested in the framework of International Labor day to demand better working conditions and in defense of Mexico's energy and digital heritage, among other demands.
On 1 May 2025, in Cancun, Quintana Roo, normal rural students from the Regional Normal Education Center (CREN) protested outside the offices of the Quintana Roo Educational Services (SEQ) to denounce the lack of trained teachers and constant schedule changes, deficiencies in basic facilities and services, lack of institutional response, among other.
On 1 May 2025, in Saltillo, Coahuila de Zaragoza, teachers from section 38 protested against the Coahuila Teachers' Union accused of neglect and lack of representation of the teachers' interests. Protesters denounced irregularities in the management of resources and demanded quality medical care and the timely delivery of medication as well as the state intervention.
On 1 May 2025, in Tierra Blanca, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, teachers members of the Union of Education Workers of Higher Technological Institutes (STEITS) protested at a school in the framework of International Labor day to denounce the lack of salary payments owed to more than 60 employees.
On 1 May 2025, in Atasta, Campeche, residents protested and blocked the Gulf coast highway 180 to demand solutions to the lack of electricity in their homes for several days.
On 1 May 2025, in Chilpancingo de los Bravo, Guerrero, residents of Colona Indeco protested in the downtown area to demand the government to fulfil its obligations to provide access to drinking water after one month without water services.
On 1 May 2025, in Chalco de Diaz Covarrubias, Mexico, residents protested and blocked the Chalco-Santa Martha trolleybus to denounce the lack of turnarounds and pedestrian crossings in several neighborhoods caused by the new public passenger transportation system.
On 1 May 2025, in Heroica Ciudad de Cananea, Sonora, around 300 workers of the National Miners' Union section 65 protested in the framework of International Labor Day to demand labor justice and a definitive solution to the conflict and dialogue with federal authorities.
On 1 May 2025, in the municipality of Atoyac, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, residents protested and blocked the Cordoba-Paso del Macho state highway near the Zapopan alcohol plant to denounce the environmental damage caused by the plant. Protesters accuse the plant of discharge pollutants into the stream and canal which affects the water of communities.
On 1 May 2025, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, workers' organizations protested in the framework of International Labor day in the downtown area to commemorate the historic defense of labor rights and to denounce setbacks in recent years. Seven teachers and members of the CNTE, retirees of the Autonomous University of Sinaloa Union, the Sinaloa Human Rights Defense Commission, the Municipal Coordinator for Housing, and the Telephone Operators Union of the Mexican Republic section 30.

graphRAG_summary:
### Conflict-Early-Warning Brief: Riots in Mexico, May 2025

**Summary of Key Developments:**

In May 2025, Mexico experienced several significant riot incidents across various states, highlighting social unrest, labor disputes, and vigilante justice.

1. **Labor and Student Protests:**
   - **Ciudad de Mexico (MEX103596, MEX103626):** On May 1, approximately 35,000 labor movement members marched to demand better labor rights and working conditions. Hooded individuals caused damage to stores and banks, and clashes with police occurred. On May 8, UNAM students marched to commemorate a student's murder and made unspecified demands, resulting in vandalism at university facilities.
   - **Toluca de Lerdo (MEX103715):** Nearly 1,000 UAEMex students demonstrated to demand the dismissal of the rector and attention to their demands, leading to graffiti and property damage.
   - **Balancan, Tabasco (MEX103864):** Students and teachers blocked a highway and clashed with riot police, demanding the dismissal of a director accused of nepotism and harassment. Several students were injured.
   - **Cuernavaca, Morelos (MEX104288):** Students set fire to public property and sprayed graffiti to demand better conditions and services.

2. **Vigilante Justice and Public Safety Concerns:**
   - **Tijuana, Baja California (MEX103608):** A Polish man was fatally stabbed and lynched after being suspected of inappropriate behavior, leading to the arrest of a bus driver.
   - **Taretan, Michoacan (MEX103598):** Residents freed impounded cars and vandalized police vehicles in protest against arbitrary arrests and abuse of power.
   - **Guadalupe, Zacatecas (MEX103916):** Residents held and beat a man accused of attempted robbery.
   - **Leon de los Aldama, Guanajuato (MEX103660):** Civilians attacked and beat two men attempting to steal a motorcycle.
   - **El Encinar, Veracruz (MEX103900):** Residents captured and beat a man accused of injuring a merchant.
   - **Xalapa-Enriquez, Veracruz (MEX104114, MEX104289):** Residents captured and beat a man accused of theft. Later, a demonstration turned violent, with hooded individuals attacking and vandalizing government and party offices.
   - **Tulancingo, Hidalgo (MEX104115):** Residents captured and beat a man accused of theft.
   - **Uman, Yucatan (MEX104113):** Residents beat and tied two suspected thieves.
   - **Tecamac de Felipe Villanueva, Mexico (MEX104117):** Individuals beat and injured two Civil Guard officers attempting to make an arrest.
   - **Chilpancingo de los Bravo, Guerrero (MEX104116):** A man was beaten, tortured, and tied to a pole after being accused of theft.

3. **Prison Clashes and Metro Protests:**
   - **La Pila, San Luis Potosi (MEX103779):** A clash between prisoners resulted in seven injuries.
   - **Ciudad de Mexico (MEX103599):** Residents demonstrated at the Hidalgo metro station over safety concerns, damaging metro facilities.

These incidents underscore ongoing social tensions, labor disputes, and public safety concerns in Mexico, necessitating close monitoring and potential intervention to prevent further escalation.
simple_summary:
### Conflict-Early-Warning Brief: Riots in Mexico, May 2025

**Summary:**

In May 2025, Mexico experienced several significant riot-related incidents across various states, highlighting issues of public unrest, vigilantism, and demands for justice and better conditions. Key developments include:

1. **Vigilantism and Public Violence:**
   - Multiple incidents of vigilantism were reported, where individuals accused of theft or other crimes were beaten, tortured, and tied up by residents. These incidents occurred in Chilpancingo de los Bravo, Guerrero (Event ID 1); Tecamac de Felipe Villanueva, Mexico (Event ID 2); Uman, Yucatan (Event ID 3); Tulancingo, Hidalgo (Event ID 4); Xalapa-Enriquez, Veracruz (Event ID 5); Cuernavaca, Morelos (Event ID 6); and El Encinar, Veracruz (Event ID 7).
   - In Tijuana, Baja California, a Polish man was lynched and stabbed after being accused of attempting to abduct a child (Event ID 8).

2. **Student Protests and Demonstrations:**
   - Students in various locations, including Cuernavaca, Morelos (Event ID 9); Ciudad de Mexico - Coyoacan (Event ID 10); Balancan, Tabasco (Event ID 11); Leon de los Aldama, Guanajuato (Event ID 12); and Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc (Event ID 13), engaged in protests and demonstrations. These actions involved setting fires, blocking highways, damaging public property, and demanding better conditions and the dismissal of officials.
   - In Balancan, Tabasco, students and teachers blocked a highway and clashed with riot police, resulting in several injuries (Event ID 11).

3. **Labor and Political Demonstrations:**
   - On International Labor Day, approximately 35,000 labor movement members marched in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, demanding respect for labor rights and better working conditions. Hooded individuals caused damage to stores and banks, and clashed with police (Event ID 14).
   - In Taretan, Michoacan de Ocampo, residents demonstrated against arbitrary arrests and abuse of power by municipal traffic officers, freeing impounded cars and vandalizing police vehicles (Event ID 15).

4. **Public Safety and Infrastructure Demands:**
   - Residents in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc demonstrated at the metro station Hidalgo over recent attacks on passengers, demanding a safer metro system. Demonstrators damaged metro facilities and lit a bonfire (Event ID 13).
   - In Xalapa-Enriquez, Veracruz, a demonstration turned violent after a tribute to a former governor, with hooded individuals attacking and vandalizing offices and businesses (Event ID 16).

These incidents underscore the need for increased public safety measures, better governance, and addressing the underlying grievances of the population to prevent further escalation.

On 15 May 2025, in Chilpancingo de los Bravo, Guerrero, a man was beaten up, tortured, and tied up to a pole by people after he was accused of being a thief. The participants also placed a cardboard with the legend 'thief' on his chest. He was left injured and tied up to a pole, until the police rescued him.
On 15 May 2025, in Xalapa-Enriquez, Veracruz, people held a demonstration after a ceremony and tribute to former governor. The demonstrators claimed that his government was fascist. The participants also demanded justice for the killing of a journalist. The demonstration turned violent when hooded individuals attacked and vandalized the offices of the INE (National Institute of Statistics) and the Institutional Revolutionary Party (PRI), as well as businesses and other buildings.
Around 14 May 2025 (as reported), in Tecamac de Felipe Villanueva, Mexico, according to witnesses and videos posted on social media, several individuals beat and injured two Civil Guard officers who attempted to arrest a man for unknown reasons. 2 injured.
Around 13 May 2025 (as reported), in Uman, Yucatan, residents beat and tied a suspected thief in colonia San Lazaro. Similarly, reasidents beat and tied another thief in colonia San Lorenzo. Municipal police officers arrived at the scene and arrested both men. 2 injured.
On 11 May 2025, in Tulancingo, Hidalgo, residents captured a man accused of theft and beat him in an attempted lynching. The man was later arrested by police officers.
On 10 May 2025, in Xalapa-Enriquez, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, residents captured a man accused of theft in the territorial reserve and beat him in an attempted lynching. The man was later arrested by police officers.
On 10 May 2025, in Cuernavaca, Morelos, students from the Amilcingo rural teacher training school demonstrated and set fire to the esplanada of the Plaza de Armas, placed banners and sprayed graffiti on the arches of the Government palace to demand the attention to several demands, such as an increase in food rations, free internet services, a swimming pool and medical personnel.
On 8 May 2025, in Tijuana, Baja California, at least three men stabbed and lynched a Polish man who suspectedly hugged a woman and her child while being under the effects of an unspecified substance on E street, in colonia Granjas Familiares II. The victim attempted to flee and boarded a bus, but was beat by the driver and other residents who, according to a version, accused him of attempting to abduct the child. The driver of the bus was arrested. 1 fatality.
On 8 May 2025, in Ciudad de Mexico - Coyoacan, students of the Autonomous University of Mexico (UNAM) marched to commemorate the anniversary of the murder of a student and to claim unspecified demands. During the demonstration, around 30 hooded individuals used unknown methods to damage guardhouses and windows and painted graffiti at the premises of the General Directorate of the College of Sciences and Humanities (CCH), the Faculties of Dentistry and Law and the rector's office due to unknown demands.
On 7 May 2025, in Balancan, Tabasco, students and teachers of the Superior Technological Institute of Los Rios demonstrated and blocked the Balancan-Villahermosa highway with poles and burning tires to demand the dismissal of the director accused of nepotism and harassment. Riot police and the National Guard intervened using tear gas to evict the students. A version of the incident indicated that the police action was preceded by unspecified attacks by some of the demonstrators. The blockade initiated on Monday 5 May 2025 after 37 days of demonstrations. After the eviction, demonstrators with their faces covered reactivated the blockade of access to the municipality. Several students were injured. Several injured.
On 6 May 2025, in Leon de los Aldama, Guanajuato, civilians attacked two men as they were attempted to steal a motorcycle at Centro Max and beat them, although security guards had already attempted to arrest them. Municipal police officers arrived and arrested both.
On 6 May 2025, in Toluca de Lerdo, Mexico, nearly 1000 students of the Autonomous University of the State of Mexico (UAEMex) of different faculties demonstrated to demand the dismissal of the rector, the annulment of the rectoral succession process and attention to their demands. Students sprayed graffiti on the rector's office building, took over it and damaged the rector's office.
On 6 May 2025, in El Encinar, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, residents captured a man accused of injuring a merchant and beat him in an attempted lynching. The man was later arrested by police officers.
On 4 May 2025, in La Pila, San Luis Potosi, there was a clash between prisoners of La Pila prison. Seven inmates were injured.
On 2 May 2025, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, residents demonstrated at the metro station Hidalgo over recent attacks on passengers and demanded a safer metro system. Demonstrators damaged the metro facilities and lit a bonfire during the demonstration.
On 2 May 2025, in Guadalupe, Zacatecas, residents of fraccionamiento Villas de Guadalupe held a man and beaten him up after he tried to rob a house.
On 1 May 2025, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, approximately 35,000 members of the labor movement, including mining workers, employees of the National Autonomous University of Mexico (UNAM), telephone operators, pilots, flight attendants, the CROC, the CROM, the Great Assembly of Workers (AGT) and transportation workers demonstrated and marched to the Zocalo in the framework of International Labor Day to demand respect for their labor rights and a decrease to weekly working hours. At the same time, teachers and members of the CNTE and the New Workers' Central (NCT) joined the demonstration at the Angel of Independence and marched to the Zocalo to demand the repeal of the 2007 reforms to the ISSSTE and decent work and wages. There were hooded individuals who caused damage to stores and banks and attacked police officers during the demonstration between Paseo de la Reforma and Juarez avenue in Colonia Centro. The officers managed to stop the individuals who were carrying firecrackers, rocks and bottles. Police officers used fire extinguishers to disperse the group.
On 1 May 2025, in Taretan, Michoacan de Ocampo, residents demonstrated outside the police station and then broke into the municipal lot and freed several impounded cars, set fire to one police car and vandalized two other police cars. The residents denounced the arbitrary arrest of a citizen and accused the municipal traffic officers of abuse of power.

graphRAG_summary:
### Summary of Violence Against Civilians in Mexico, May 2025

In May 2025, Mexico experienced a significant number of violent incidents targeting civilians, with a notable concentration in specific states. The violence included shootings, kidnappings, and torture, often involving organized crime groups.

**Key Developments:**

1. **High Fatality Incidents:**
   - **Michoacan de Ocampo:** On May 6, six people were killed in Villa Madero, with bodies found on a road, showing signs of torture and decapitation (MEX103728).
   - **Zacatecas:** On May 13, six people were killed in San Pedro Piedra Gorda, with bodies found dismembered in a vehicle (MEX103960).
   - **Guanajuato:** On May 1, five people were killed in Salamanca, with bodies found in a vehicle showing signs of torture (MEX103358).
   - **Tabasco:** On May 2, five people were killed in Villahermosa, including a lawyer and his minor son (MEX103871).

2. **Multiple Fatalities:**
   - **Veracruz:** On May 11, five people, including a Morena candidate for mayor and her supporters, were killed in Texistepec (MEX103973).
   - **Tabasco:** On May 14, four people were killed in C-14, with bodies found burned and showing signs of torture (MEX104040).

3. **Frequent Single Fatalities:**
   - Multiple incidents across various states, including Baja California, Sinaloa, Guanajuato, and Tabasco, reported single fatalities with bodies often found in advanced states of decomposition, wrapped in plastic, or showing signs of torture (e.g., MEX103346, MEX103347, MEX103348, MEX103349).

4. **Kidnappings and Injuries:**
   - Several incidents involved kidnappings and injuries, with victims often found with signs of torture or beatings. For example, in Baja California, multiple kidnappings and shootings were reported, with victims injured or abducted (e.g., MEX103246, MEX103247).

5. **Political and Criminal Motives:**
   - Some incidents appeared to be politically motivated, targeting local officials, candidates, and journalists. For instance, a Morena candidate in Veracruz and a local journalist in Guerrero were killed (MEX103973, MEX104019).
   - Other incidents were linked to organized crime, with messages left by criminal groups claiming responsibility (e.g., MEX103960, MEX103677).

**Conclusion:**
The violence in May 2025 highlighted the ongoing challenges of organized crime and political violence in Mexico. The incidents underscored the need for enhanced security measures and targeted interventions to address the root causes of violence and protect civilians.
simple_summary:
### Summary of Violence Against Civilians in Mexico, May 2025

**Key Developments:**

1. **Kidnappings and Abductions:**
   - Multiple incidents of kidnappings and abductions were reported, including the abduction of a man and his two sons in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa (Event ID: 1). Another notable incident involved the abduction of a woman from her business in Tijuana, Baja California, by individuals in police uniforms (Event ID: 14).

2. **Targeted Assassinations:**
   - Several high-profile individuals were targeted, including a former Director of Traffic in Villahermosa, Tabasco (Event ID: 3), a local journalist in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero (Event ID: 15), and a mayor in El Mamey, Oaxaca (Event ID: 18).
   - Multiple political figures and candidates were also targeted, such as a Morena candidate for mayor in Texistepec, Veracruz (Event ID: 26), and a local Education councilman in Santiago Niltepec, Oaxaca (Event ID: 30).

3. **Drive-by Shootings:**
   - Numerous drive-by shootings occurred, resulting in multiple fatalities and injuries. Notable incidents include shootings in Leon de los Aldama, Guanajuato (Event IDs: 6, 20, 29), and Villahermosa, Tabasco (Event ID: 21).

4. **Extrajudicial Killings and Torture:**
   - Several bodies were found with signs of torture and gunshot wounds, indicating extrajudicial killings. For example, a man was found with signs of torture and gunshot wounds in Villahermosa, Tabasco (Event ID: 19).
   - Beheadings and mutilations were also reported, such as in Alpuyeca, Morelos (Event ID: 11), and Cuauhtemoc, Zacatecas (Event ID: 24).

5. **Organized Crime Involvement:**
   - Many incidents were linked to organized crime groups, including messages left by cartels such as the CJNG and La Rusada Gang in Guerrero (Event IDs: 25, 27, 28).
   - Several attacks were suspected to be related to drug trafficking disputes and extortion, such as in Leon de los Aldama, Guanajuato (Event ID: 29), and Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero (Event ID: 26).

6. **High Fatality Incidents:**
   - Multiple incidents resulted in high fatalities, such as the killing of six people in San Pedro Piedra Gorda, Zacatecas (Event ID: 13), and the killing of six people in Villa Madero, Michoacan (Event ID: 23).

7. **Public Transport and Civilian Targets:**
   - Several incidents involved attacks on public transport drivers and civilians, including taxi drivers in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero (Event ID: 2), and a leader of a public transport network in Ciudad Nezahualcoyotl, Mexico (Event ID: 20).

8. **Police and Security Forces Involvement:**
   - Some incidents involved police officers, such as the abduction of a woman by individuals in police uniforms in Tijuana, Baja California (Event ID: 14), and the shooting of a taxi driver by off-duty police officers in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero (Event ID: 26).

**Conclusion:**
The month of May 2025 saw a significant number of violent incidents against civilians in Mexico, involving kidnappings, targeted assassinations, drive-by shootings, and extrajudicial killings. The involvement of organized crime groups and the targeting of political figures and public transport drivers highlight the ongoing security challenges in the country.

On 14 May 2025, in Tijuana, Baja California, two men wearing ministerial police uniforms and a municipal police officer abducted a woman from her business (Abarrotes Rubi) in colonia La Morita, and extorted her by demanding a payment of 50,000 pesos to allow her to keep the store. Another group of municipal police officers chased the perpetrators, who travelled in a pick-up and a police vehicle. The perpetrators abandoned the vehicles and fled, and the officers released the victim. The police officer who participated in the abduction was later arrested.
Around 14 May 2025 (as reported), in Silao de la Victoria, Guanajuato, two men abducted a man. Municipal police officers arrested the perpetrators and released the victim the same day.

The reasons for the attack are unknown. According to the victim and a witness, this attack was a case of unjustified violence, since the victim was not armed and had not committed any crime. 1 injured.

On 14 May 2025, in Tlaquepaque, Jalisco, according to witnesses, two armed men shot and killed a man in Colonia Guayabitos. 1 fatality.
Around 14 May 2025 (as reported), in Bahia Tortugas, Baja California Sur, a man was killed and his body was found with gunshot wounds in a house that was set on fire on Langosta street, in colonia Infonavit. 1 fatality.

On 14 May 2025, in Leon de los Aldama, Guanajuato, armed men in a vehicle shot and injured a man (drive-by) in colonia San Isidro.

graphRAG_summary:
### Strategic Developments in Mexico, May 2025

**Key Developments:**

1. **Arrests and Seizures:**
   - **Michoacán de Ocampo:** Authorities arrested key figures in the CJNG, including a financial operator and a woman with drugs (MEX103299).
   - **Sinaloa:** Significant seizures of drug production materials and precursor chemicals, including the dismantling of clandestine laboratories and the seizure of large quantities of precursors (MEX103417, MEX103434, MEX103441, MEX103806).
   - **Guerrero:** A large cocaine seizure off the coast of Acapulco de Juárez (MEX103426).
   - **Ciudad de México:** The arrest of a CJNG leader and several members, along with the seizure of drugs, vehicles, and tactical equipment (MEX103959).

2. **Property Destruction and Roadblocks:**
   - **Michoacán de Ocampo:** Multiple narco roadblocks set up by armed individuals, often in response to clashes with authorities (MEX103446, MEX103447, MEX103464, MEX103465, MEX103466, MEX103467, MEX103468, MEX103723, MEX103725, MEX103726).
   - **Sinaloa:** Numerous incidents of property destruction, including the burning of vehicles, setting up of roadblocks, and shootings at houses and businesses (MEX103831, MEX103846, MEX103805, MEX103806, MEX103807, MEX103808, MEX103809, MEX103813, MEX103816, MEX104106).
   - **Guanajuato:** Armed individuals set fire to vehicles as part of narco roadblocks (MEX103672).

3. **Security Operations and Defusals:**
   - **Sinaloa:** Multiple defusals of improvised explosive devices (IEDs) and the seizure of drones used by armed groups (MEX103431, MEX103847, MEX104072, MEX104073, MEX104075, MEX104080).
   - **Guerrero:** Seizure of security cameras illegally installed by criminal groups (MEX103674).
   - **Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave:** Deployment of federal officers to reinforce security ahead of local elections (MEX104068).

4. **Drug Production and Trafficking:**
   - **Sinaloa and Chiapas:** Seizure of multiple narco laboratories and large quantities of methamphetamine and marijuana (MEX104078, MEX104082, MEX104083).
   - **Chiapas:** Seizure of over 2 tons of cocaine being transported (MEX104095).
   - **Nayarit:** Destruction of poppy plantations (MEX104093).

5. **Armed Clashes and Attacks:**
   - **Sinaloa:** Several incidents of armed clashes and attacks on houses and businesses, often linked to rival gangs (MEX103801, MEX103805, MEX103806, MEX103807, MEX103809, MEX103813, MEX103816).
   - **Nayarit:** Attack on a municipal hall and nearby stores (MEX104098).

6. **Security Measures and Operations:**
   - **Baja California:** Seizure of large quantities of cocaine and fentanyl pills in a building belonging to the CJNG (MEX104079).
   - **Chihuahua, Durango, Guerrero, Oaxaca:** Destruction of poppy and marijuana plantations (MEX104086, MEX104088, MEX104089, MEX104091).

These developments

Property destruction: On 15 May 2025, in Damaso Cardenas, Sinaloa, according to residents armed individuals set houses on fire and vehicles. This event was replicated in other locations in the municipality (coded separately).
Property destruction: On 15 May 2025, in Rafael Buelna, Sinaloa, according to residents armed individuals set houses on fire and vehicles. This event was replicated in other locations in the municipality (coded separately).
On 14 May 2025, in Ciudad de Mexico, municipal police, army, navy and National Guard officers, together with agents of Ciudad de Mexico Attorney General's office, arrested the leader of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel (CJNG) in the city during search operations in Coyoacan and Iztapalapa. The arrestee led a cell that operated in Coyoacan, Iztapalapa and Xochimilco. Three other members of the cartel were arrested and the authorities seized drugs, vehicles and tactical equipment.
Looting: Around 14 May 2025 (as reported), in Baila, Sinaloa, suspected gang members 'violently' stole the van in which the mayor of Concordia of the MORENA party and public employees travelled on Mexico-Nogales federal road (methods unknown). At the moment of the incident, the mayor was heading to a meeting at the State Government Palace. The vehicle was later found near the community of Laguna de Canachi.
Security measures: Around 13 May 2025 (as reported), in Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave state (coded to Xalapa-Enriquez), the authorities deployed 300 federal officers (likely military and National Guard officers) to reinforce security in the framework of the local elections scheduled in the state for 1 June 2025.
Defusal: Around 13 May 2025 (as reported), in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, military officers defused 13 IED that the National Guard found in colonia Colinas de Tamazula. A man who was suspectedly linked to the devices fled.
Defusal: On 13 May 2025, in Villahermosa, Tabasco, military officers defused a suspected explosive device that was found by military, National Guard and state police officers inside a suitcase on Piruli street, in colonia Gaviotas Sur.
Property destruction: Around 13 May 2025 (as reported), off the coast of Guerrero, navy officers seized 1,364 kg. of cocaine inside 68 packages. The operation was coordinated with agents of the Federal Attorney General's office and army, National Guard and state police officers.
Property destruction: Around 13 May 2025 (as reported), in La Salatera, Michoacan de Ocampo, military and Civil Guard officers destroyed a narco laboratory.
Property destruction: Around 13 May 2025 (as reported), in Rancho El Naranjo, Jalisco, National Guard officers destroyed two marijuana plantations that contained 25,890 plants.

graphRAG_summary:
### Summary of Key Battles in Mexico, May 2025

In May 2025, Mexico experienced a series of significant armed conflicts, particularly concentrated in Sinaloa and Nuevo Leon, with notable incidents in other states as well. The clashes often involved rival criminal groups, military forces, and law enforcement agencies.

**Sinaloa** saw intense violence, with multiple clashes between Los Mayitos and Los Chapitos gangs. Key events include:
- **May 5**: Multiple armed clashes in Sinaloa, including in La Lapara, El Huajote, and between Guamuchil and Mocorito, resulting in several fatalities and the setting of narco roadblocks (MEX103790, MEX103794, MEX103850).
- **May 7**: Several armed clashes and roadblocks were reported across Sinaloa, linked to the arrest of a member of Los Mayitos (MEX103822, MEX103834, MEX103835).
- **May 10**: Ongoing clashes between Los Mayitos and Los Chapitos gangs, with roadblocks and vehicle burnings (MEX103934, MEX103935).

**Nuevo Leon** also experienced significant violence:
- **May 5**: An armed clash in Rayones resulted in five fatalities, with vehicles set on fire to create roadblocks (MEX103757).
- **May 16**: Another clash in Montemorelos led to four fatalities (MEX103944).

**Guerrero** saw a major clash in Zihuatanejo on **May 13**, resulting in at least 10 fatalities and the arrest of four individuals (MEX103957).

**Veracruz** had notable incidents:
- **May 12**: A clash in Boca del Rio involving federal ministerial police resulted in three fatalities (MEX103945).

**Other States**:
- **Michoacan de Ocampo**: Multiple clashes with military and police forces, including incidents on **May 5**, **May 6**, and **May 7** (MEX103741, MEX103742, MEX103720).
- **Sonora**: A drive-by shooting in Ciudad Obregon on **May 8** resulted in three fatalities (MEX103857).
- **Guanajuato**: Several incidents on **May 6** resulted in fatalities (MEX103651, MEX103671, MEX103673).

These conflicts highlight the ongoing struggle between criminal organizations and law enforcement, as well as inter-gang violence, particularly in regions with significant drug trafficking activity. The use of narco roadblocks and vehicle burnings was a common tactic to disrupt law enforcement operations and assert territorial control.
simple_summary:
### Summary of Key Battles in Mexico, May 2025

**May 2025 saw a significant number of armed clashes across Mexico, primarily involving criminal groups, police, and military forces. The conflicts were particularly intense in Sinaloa, Michoacán, and other states.**

1. **Sinaloa:**
   - **High-Intensity Clashes:** Multiple armed clashes occurred between rival gangs, particularly Los Mayitos and Los Chapitos, leading to fatalities and the establishment of narco roadblocks. Key events include clashes in Montemorelos (Event ID: 1), Juan Aldama (Event ID: 2), Licenciado Benito Juarez (Event ID: 3), Potrerillo del Norote (Event ID: 4), and several other locations.
   - **Military and Police Engagements:** There were frequent confrontations between armed individuals and military or police forces, resulting in seizures of weapons, vehicles, and arrests. Notable incidents include clashes in Rafael Buelna (Event ID: 10), Culiacan Rosales (Event ID: 9), and Licenciado Benito Juarez (Event ID: 8).

2. **Michoacán:**
   - **Ongoing Violence:** Armed clashes between criminal groups and security forces were reported in Santiago Acahuato (Event ID: 5), Las Tinajas (Event ID: 7), and other areas. These incidents often involved the use of heavy weaponry and resulted in arrests and seizures.
   - **Civilian Involvement:** There were reports of civilians being caught in the crossfire, leading to injuries and fatalities. For example, in La Cieneguilla (Event ID: 6), a family was caught in the crossfire, resulting in two fatalities.

3. **Other States:**
   - **Guerrero:** A significant clash in Zihuatanejo (Event ID: 13) resulted in at least 10 fatalities and the arrest of several individuals.
   - **Ciudad de Mexico:** Rival gangs engaged in clashes in Cuauhtemoc (Event ID: 12) and Iztapalapa (Event ID: 12), leading to fatalities and injuries.
   - **Veracruz:** An armed clash in Boca del Rio (Event ID: 12) resulted in multiple fatalities and injuries, with authorities conducting anti-abduction operations.

4. **Narco Roadblocks and Violence:**
   - **Widespread Impact:** Narco roadblocks were a common tactic used by criminal groups to disrupt traffic and assert control. These were reported in various locations, including Sinaloa, Michoacán, and other states.
   - **Public Safety:** The clashes often led to the suspension of public activities and the disruption of daily life, with residents reporting gunshots and the presence of armed individuals.

**Conclusion:**
The armed clashes in May 2025 highlighted the ongoing conflict between criminal groups and security forces in Mexico. The intensity and frequency of these incidents underscore the need for continued vigilance and strategic responses to address the underlying issues driving the violence.
corpus:
On 16 May 2025, in Montemorelos, Nuevo Leon, there was an armed clash between armed individuals and the municipal police after the armed men kidnapped a man (coded separately). Four armed men were killed. 4 fatalities.
On 16 May 2025, in Juan Aldama (El Tigre), Sinaloa, there was an armed clash between armed individuals. Casualties unknown.
On 15 May 2025, in Licenciado Benito Juarez (Villa Juarez), Sinaloa, there was an armed clash between armed individuals and military officers during a patrol where officers were attacked. The officers repelled the attack. There were no casualties. Weapons and vehicles were seized.
On 15 May 2025, in Santiago Acahuato, Michoacan, there was an armed clash between members of criminal groups and state police and military officers during a police patrol. The armed men shot at the police who repelled the attack. Three armed men were arrested. Weapons and drugs were seized. There were no casualties.
On 15 May 2025, in Guachochi, Chihuahua, according to residents, there was at least three armed clashes between members of criminal groups during the night. Several vehicles were set on fire. A house was also damage. Casualties unknown.
On 14 May 2025, in Potrerillo del Norote, Sinaloa, there was an armed clash between armed individuals and military officers during a patrol. Four armed men were killed. Weapons were seized. 4 fatalities.
On 14 May 2025, between Pueblo Nuevo and La Cruz, Sinaloa, unidentified individuals shot at two suspected gang members on Culiacan-Mazatlan highway. The latter had just carried out a drive-by attack in La Cruz (coded separately). Both groups clashed along the highway until one of the vehicles crashed on km. 94, where two men died. 2 fatalities.
Around 13 May 2025 (as reported), in La Salatera, Michoacan de Ocampo, three suspected members of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel (CJNG) shot at Civil Guard and military officers. The officers shot back, arrested the three men and seized three fireweapons and around one kg. of marijuana. There were no casualties.
On 13 May 2025, in Zihuatanejo, Guerrero, suspected gang members clashed across colonias Dario Galeana, Morelos, Amuzgos and Los Pinos and the surroundings of CETIS 45. At least 10 people died. After the clash, during a search operation, the authorities arrested four individuals and seized drug. At least 10 fatalities.
On 12 May 2025, near Coroches, Sinaloa, unknown armed individuals opened fire at military personnel who shot back. Officers seized firearms, magazines and ammunition. The were no casualties.
On 12 May 2025, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, rival groups engaged in an armed clash inside a bar in Colonia Santa Maria La Ribera. Two members of a gang died and three were injured and identified as Venezuelan and suspected members of the Tren de Aragua gang. 2 fatalities, 3 injuries.
On 12 May 2025, in Boca del Rio, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, according to witnesses, unknown armed men chased and opened fire at federal ministerial police officers in the intersection of Via Muerta avenue and Nueva Espana street, in Colonia Playa Hermosa, who shot back. Two officers and an armed woman were killed. An officer was injured. At the moment of the attack, the officers were conducting an anti-abduction operation that led to the release of an unspecified number of victims. An alternative version indicated that they were investigating the killing of a Morena candidate in Texistepec on 11 May 2025 (coded separately). 3 fatalities, 1 injured.
On 12 May 2025, in Caborca, Sonora, armed individuals opened fire at two members of the federal ministerial police who shot back in Colonia Santa Cecilia. Two officers were injured and the perpetrators fled the scene.
On 12 May 2025, in Boscoso, Sinaloa, armed rival groups engaged in an armed clash although the clash was not confirmed by authorities. There were no casualties.
On 12 May 2025, in Los Tanques, Sinaloa, armed rival groups engaged in an armed clash although the clash was not confirmed by authorities. There were no casualties.
On 12 May 2025, in Ciudad de Mexico - Iztapalapa, suspected rival criminal gangs dedicated to theft through the sale of vehicles engaged in an armed clash in Colonia Mixcoatl. One individual died as a result. 1 fatality.
On 11 May 2025, in Carrizalejo, Sinaloa, armed men opened fire at military officials, who shot back next to a gas station located about 500 meters south of the paved highway to Sanalona. Seven men were arrested and officials seized cars, weapons, ammunition, and tactical equipment. It is suspected that at least one unspecified explosive device was also used. Following the clash, a military operation was launched in coordination with the Secretariat of Security and Citizen Protection (SSPC), which resulted in the arrest of seven men and the seizure of 18 long weapons, 2,978 cartridges, 10 tactical vests and 3 vehicles (one with handmade armor). There were no casualties.
On 11 May 2025, in San Juan Cacahuatepec, Oaxaca, armed individuals attacked and shot at police officers who shot back during a surveillance operation. One individual died and seven were arrested. 1 fatality.
On 11 May 2025, near Pie de la Cuesta, Oaxaca, at least eight men shot at state police officers. The officers shot back, killed one of the individuals, arrested seven men. and seized fireweapons, drugs and five vehicles. 1 fatality.
Around 11 May 2025 (as reported), in Choix, Sinaloa, two people were killed and their bodies were found with gunshot wounds, with signs of torture and a message next to the bodies at the entrance to the town. One of the victims was identified as a criminal local leader (likely gang) and was wanted by the DEA. 2 fatalities.
Around 10 May 2025 (as reported), in Ejido Batamote, Sinaloa, there was an armed clash between Los Mayitos gang and Los Chapitos gang. Tire punctures ('pochallantas') were also thrown and vehicles were looted, likely to set up (narco) roadblocks. Casualties unknown.
On 10 May 2025, in Los Mochis, Sinaloa, there was an armed clash between Los Mayitos gang and Los Chapitos gang. An unspecified number of vehicles were set on fire to set a (narco) roadblock on the Mochis-Topolobampo highway and (narco) roadblocks were also set on the 15 International highway. The clash initiated the previous night (coded separately) and continued into the early morning. Casualties unknown.
On 10 May 2025, in Rafael Buelna, Sinaloa, armed clashes took place between armed individuals (likely members of one faction of the Sinaloa Cartel) and the military. One soldier was injured and seven armed men were arrested. The military seized four trucks with homemade armor. The clash occurred amid several armed clashes in the area between the Los Mayitos Gang and the Los Chapitos gang.
Around 10 May 2025 (as reported), in Valle de Chalco Solidaridad, Mexico, municipal police officers and agents of the Attorney General's Office of the State of Mexico (FGJEM) were shot at and beaten with blunt objects by an unspecified number of people while conducting a search as part of a police operation named 'Operacion Fortaleza'. The police responded to the attack by shooting in the air. Five police officers were injured.
On 10 May 2025, in Ranchito de Zavala, Sinaloa, during a surveillance operation, municipal police officers were shot at by an armed man they flagged down while he was riding a motorcycle. The man, after being requested by the police, got out of the vehicle and fled on foot, firing shots at the police. The motorcycle was seized. There were no casualties.
On 10 May 2025, in Veracruz, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, at night, a state police officer assigned to guard a house in Colonia Los Torrentes was assaulted and shot at by a person he had suspected of having just searched. A person who was under house arrest inside the guarded house defended the policeman (methods unknown). The perpetrator fled and took the police officer's belongings. 1 injured.
Around 9 May 2025 (as reported), in Caborca, Sonora, three men abducted two members of a rival criminal group. Agents of the Criminal Investigations Ministerial Agency (AMIC) and military officers arrested the perpetrators and released the victims. One of the victims was immediately arrested, since he was being searched for the murder of two United States citizens committed on 23 November 2024 (coded separately).
On 9 May 2025, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, military and National Guard officers chased and clashed with unidentified individuals at the southern exit of the city. The persecution continued until km. 189 of Mexico 15 international road by El Carrizal, where the individuals crashed their vehicle and one of them died. It is unknown whether the death was caused by shots or the crash. 1 fatality.
On 9 May 2025, in Los Mochis, Sinaloa, at night, there was an armed clash between Los Mayitos gang and Los Chapitos gang. An unspecified number of vehicles were set on fire to set a (narco) roadblock on the Mochis-Topolobampo highway and (narco) roadblocks were also set on the 15 International highway. The clash lasted into the early hours of the following day (coded separately). Casualties unknown.
Around 8 May 2025 (as reported), in Ciudad de Mexico - Gustavo A. Madero, a man shot at municipal police officers who approached him for carrying a gun during public celebrations in colonia San Juan de Aragon. The officers shot back and slightly injured the man, who was arrested. 1 injured.
On 8 May 2025, in Mazatlan, Sinaloa, unidentified individuals chased, shot and killed an agent of the State Attorney General's office at a gas station in fraccionamiento Puesta del Sol. Two individuals who were near the body of the victim after the attack and were carrying a weapon were arrested, although it was unknown whether they were linked to the attack. 1 fatality.
Around 8 May 2025 (as reported), in Mazatlan, Sinaloa, unidentified individuals clashed and set (narco) roadblocks on the roads to Escuianapa. Casualties unknown.
On 8 May 2025, in Licenciado Benito Juarez, Sinaloa, unidentified individuals ambushed and shot at military officers, injuring two. 2 injured.
On 8 May 2025, in Ciudad Obregon, Sonora, individuals on a motorcycle shot and killed three men who were in a vehicle in the intersection of Martires de Chicago and Martires de Rio Blanco streets, in colonia Primero de Mayo (drive-by). The attack suspectedly responded to a dispute over drug trafficking, since the authorities found methamphetamine and marijuana and two fireweapons inside the victims' vehicle. The vehicle had been stolen in Arizona, United States. 3 fatalities.
On 8 May 2025, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, unidentified individuals clashed in the intersection of Ejercito Nacional avenue and Plan de Ayala boulevard in colonia Emiliano Zapata, in colonia Guadalupe Victoria (also known as fraccionamiento Punta Azul), and in the intersection of Sinaloa boulevard and Ciudad de Tepic street, in sector Las Quintas. Casualties unknown.
On 7 May 2025, in Ciudad de Mexico - Gustavo A. Madero, one man opened fire at police officers who approached him accused of suspicious behavior. The police officers shot back in Colonia San Juan de Aragon and arrested the man. The man was injured and arrested. The attack took place during a procession in which police officers were conducting surveillance.
On 7 May 2025, between El Alcalde and Presa de Rosario, Michoacan de Ocampo, unknown armed individuals described as members of organized crime engaged in an armed clash with the military and unspecified police forces. An armed helicopter also participated in armed actions. Casualties unknown.
On 7 May 2025, in Las Tinajas, Michoacan de Ocampo, unknown armed individuals opened fire at elements of the National Guard and military officers who were conducting surveillance leading to the death of three suspected criminals wearing tactical equipment. Thirteen people were arrested, including nine foreign citizens and officers seized weapons. 3 fatalities.
On 7 May 2025, in Catalinas Viejas, Michoacan de Ocampo, two boys opened fire at elements of the National Guard, municipal and state police officers during an operation who shot back. Both minors were arrested as a result. Officers seized a rifle, two motorcycles, ammunition and tactical equipment. There were no casualties.
On 7 May 2025, in Morelia, Michoacan de Ocampo, unknown armed individuals fired shots at state police officers from Guanajuato from their motorcycle at an intersection (drive-by) near Colonia Loma. Two officers and one civilian were injured as a result. 2 injuries.
On 7 May 2025, in San Pedro y San Pablo Teposcolula, Oaxaca, agents of the State Agency of Investigations (AEI) and state police officers clashed with three men in the intersection of Hidalgo and Francisco I. Madero streets. The men had previously abducted a man in San Miguel El Grande who was released (coded separately). An officer died, another was injured and the three men were arrested. 1 fatality, 1 injured.
On 7 May 2025, in San Cristobal Tepatlaxco, Puebla, unidentified individuals subdued (methods unknown) and tied two state police officers who were guarding a house and released a man who was under house arrest. Police officers chased and clashed with the individuals in colonia La Joya, killing the man who had been released. Two officers were injured. 1 fatality, 2 injured.
On 7 May 2025, in San Martin Texmelucan de Labastida, Puebla, armed individuals opened fire at municipal police officers after a shooting was reported in Colonia El Arenal leading to a chase that ended on highway 117. Three people were injured, including one police officer.
On 7 May 2025, in the municipality of Badiraguato, Sinaloa, armed clashes between individuals described as criminals took place in towns surrounding the municipality. The event is being linked to the arrest of a member of Los Mayitos. Three people were killed. 3 fatalities.
On 7 May 2025, in El Barril, Sinaloa, armed individuals described as criminal groups engaged in an armed clash. The event is being linked to the arrest of a member of Los Mayitos. Casualties unknown.
On 7 May 2025, in the municipality of Elota, Sinaloa, armed groups engaged in an armed clash and looted vehicles, which they set on fire and used to set a (narco) roadblock. Two people died. Similar events took place across Sinaloa the same day (coded separately). 2 fatalities.
On 7 May 2025, in Caimanero, Sinaloa, armed groups engaged in an armed clash. The event is being linked to the arrest of a member of Los Mayitos. Casualties unknown.
On 7 May 2025, in Mazatlan, Sinaloa, armed groups engaged in an armed clash and two people were killed. The event is being linked to the arrest of a member of the Sinaloa Cartel. 2 fatalities.
On 7 May 2025, in Mazatlan, Sinaloa, several individuals on two vehicles opened fire at on-duty municipal police officers who were having dinner at a tacos stand on Monte Ribereno avenue, in fraccionamiento Pradera Dorada 6 (drive-by). One police officer died inside the patrol car and the other at the stand. Two officers and two civilians were injured. 2 fatalities, 4 injured.
On 7 May 2025, in Pericos, Sinaloa, armed groups engaged in an armed clash and used 'ponchallantas' (objects to puncture tires) to set a (narco) roadblock. The event was suspectedly linked to the arrest of a member of Los Mayitos. Casualties unknown.
On 7 May 2025, in Licenciado Benito Juarez, Sinaloa, unidentified individuals clashed and looted vehicles, which they set on fire and used to set (narco) roadblocks along La 20 road. An explosive device suspectedly linked to this clash was found the day after in front of the IMSS hospital. Similar events took place across Sinaloa the same day (coded separately). Casualties unknown.
On 7 May 2025, in the municipality of Rosario (coded to El Rosario), Sinaloa, unidentified individuals suspectedly clashed and used several vehicles to set a (narco) roadblock over Baluarte river, on Mazatlan-Tepic road. Similar events took place across Sinaloa the same day (coded separately). Casualties unknown.
On 7 May 2025, in Guamuchil, Sinaloa, unidentified individuals suspectedly clashed, and burned vehicles and used them to set a (narco) roadblock on the southern road to Mocorito. Similar events took place across Sinaloa the same day (coded separately). Casualties unknown.
On 7 May 2025, in Ciudad Obregon, Sonora, armed individuals opened fire at officers from the Criminal Investigation agency (AMIC) who shot back while they were carrying out an operation in Colonia Bellavista. One armed individual was injured and officers arrested three individuals and seized weapons and a vehicle.
On 7 May 2025, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, unidentified individuals clashed and looted a trailer, a truck and a van, which they used to set a (narco) roadblock on Mexico 15 highway. The perpetrators later moved the vehicles and set them on fire to block the northern exit of the city. Simultaneously, they used 'ponchallantas' (objects to puncture tires) to block Gabriel Leyva Solano boulevard. Drones were seen over the roadblocks, although it is unknown whether they were used by criminal groups or the authorities. The event was suspectedly linked to the arrest of a member of the Los Mayitos. Similar events took place across Sinaloa the same day (coded separately). A person died. 1 fatality.
On 7 May 2025, in El Batallon, Sinaloa, armed groups clashed and looted vehicles, which they set on fire and used to set a (narco) roadblock on Benito Juarez highway. The event was suspectedly linked to the arrest of a member of the Los Mayitos. Similar events took place across Sinaloa the same day (coded separately). Casualties unknown.
On 6 May 2025, in La Cieneguilla, Sinaloa, several armed men in pick up trucks opened fire at members of the Sinaloa Prosecutor's office and the military who shot back (drive-by). This attack is suspected to be linked to the arrest of a member of Los Mayitos. The officers were on their way to Badiraguato escorted by military after receiving the reports of three people found dead and were ambushed by armed men. A family was caught in the crossfire and two girls died as a result and four members were injured. Five soldiers were also injured. 2 fatalities.
On 6 May 2025, in Celaya, Guanajuato, a group of armed men opened fire at an element of the National Guard in a patrol car parked under a bridge on the highway towards San Miguel de Allende. One officer died as a result. 1 fatality.
On 6 May 2025, in Valle de Santiago, Guanajuato, armed individuals on a motorcycle ambushed a municipal police driver driving in his patrol car on Colon street, in the sector Alameda and then fled the scene (drive-by). The police officer died as a result. 1 fatality.
On 6 May 2025, in Yuriria, Guanajuato, armed individuals described as criminals opened fire at municipal police officers when they were caught attempting to abandon a body. The officers shot back leading to the death of one armed individual. Six individuals fled the scene on three motorcycles and set fire to a vehicle (coded separately). 1 fatality.
On 6 May 2025, in Buenavista Tomatlan, Michoacan de Ocampo, a group of armed men attacked two municipal guardhouses at the exit to Tepalcatepec and next to the municipal cemetery. The men fled towards La Ruana. One officer was injured as a result.
On 6 May 2025, in Santiago Tangamandapio, Michoacan de Ocampo, unknown armed individuals opened fire at elements of the military who shot back. Three armed individuals were killed and weapons, magazines and cartridges were seized. 3 fatalities.
On 6 May 2025, in Santiago Momoxpan, Puebla, armed individuals described as criminals attacked municipal police officers on the Recta a Cholula highway who shot back. One vehicle was seized. There were no casualties.
On 6 May 2025, in Tepeojuma, Puebla, at least four armed individuals opened fire at municipal police officers who shot back in Colonia San Francisco. Four men were arrested. There were no casualties.
Around 6 May 2025 (as reported), in Los Tanques, Sinaloa, there was an armed clash between armed individuals, and then an unknown armed individual staged a (narco) roadblock on the Mazatlan-Culiacan highway. Casualties unknown.
On 6 May 2025, in Cristo Rey, Sinaloa, armed individuals opened fire at municipal police and elements of the Navy on patrol who shot back at the individuals. One armed individual died and two police officers were injured as a result. 1 fatality, 2 injured.
On 6 May 2025, in San Luis Rio Colorado, Sonora, two armed men shot at members of the Navy personnel, who fired back and then arrested both men. A weapon and narcotics were seized. There were no casualties.
On 6 May 2025, in Reynosa, Tamaulipas, unknown armed men described as suspected criminals attacked state police officers who shot back in Colonia Narciso Mendoza and then chased the individuals to Colonia Loma Linda. The armed men crashed and officers seized the vehicle. One armed man died as a result the next day. 1 fatality.
On 5 May 2025, in Coyame del Sotol municipality (coded to Coyame), Chihuahua, there was an armed clash between the New Juarez Cartel and Los Cabrera Gang on the road going to San Pedro. Casualties unknown.
On 5 May 2025, in La Cantera, Michoacan, there was an armed clash between armed individuals and the military officers. Three armed men were killed. Weapons were seized. 3 fatalities.
On 5 May 2025, in Rayones, Nuevo Leon, armed individuals engaged in an armed clash on the Rayones-Mesa del Naranjo highway, leaving at least 5 people dead. The bodies were not found at the scene, although an investigation is continuing. Several vehicles were set on fire to set (narco) roadblocks. According to police sources, the groups belong to the CDN and the CJNG. After the shooting, six trucks were abandoned, three of which were burned. Residents' vehicles were also damaged by bullets, including one home. 5 fatalities.
On 5 May 2025, in El Ranchito, Sinaloa, armed clashes between different armed groups were reported leading to the suspension of public activities. This event was sparked by the arrest of a member of Los Mayitos. (coded separately). Casualties unknown.
On 5 May 2025, in La Lapara, Sinaloa, there was an armed clash between armed individuals. Three people were killed. After the clash, armed men made a ditch on the road that connects La Lapara to the municipal seat (coded separately). 3 fatalities.
On 5 May 2025, in El Huajote, Sinaloa, there was an armed clash between armed groups, and (narco) roadblocks were set. Unofficially, three people were killed. This event was sparked after an armed clash between armed individuals in La Lapara (coded separately). 3 fatalities.
On 5 May 2025, in Isla del Bosque, Sinaloa, different armed groups engaged in an armed clash near the intersection that connects to the Escuinapa-Teacapan highway, where individuals set fire to two vans as part of a (narco) roadblock.
On 5 May 2025, in Licenciado Benito Juarez, Sinaloa, there was an armed clash between different armed groups, leading to the suspension of public activities. This event was sparked by the arrest of a member of Los Mayitos. (coded separately). Casualties unknown.
On 5 May 2025, between Guamuchil and Mocorito, Sinaloa, an armed clash occurred between armed men in pickup trucks (drive-by), starting in Mocorito and ending in Guamuchil. Three men died-two were found in San Benito and one was found in a vehicle in Colonia La Gloria. Five houses, two in Mocorito and three in Guamuchil, were shot at. A pickup truck with handmade armor was found in Colonia La Cuesta de la Higuera, along with 7.62 x 51 caliber cartridges. Two people were injured, including a 17-year-old shot in the head by a stray bullet in Colonia Primero de Mayo. Videos of the clashes circulated on social media. It is rumored and suspected the involvement from Los Mayitos Gang trying to invade Los Chapitos Gang territory. The clashes affected several communities, including Palmar de los Leal, San Benito, and El Jalon. (Narco) roadblocks were set up in Las Brisas (coded separately). 3 fatalities.
On 5 May 2025, in Acayucan, Veracruz, according to witnesses, armed men shot and killed a man after they entered a house in barrio Tamarindo. Drugs and weapons were found inside the house. 1 fatality.
On 5 May 2025, in Loreto municipality, Baja California Sur, there was an armed clash between the municipal police and military officers against suspected members of Los Chapitos Gang on km. 5 of Loreto-San Javier road. Three armed men were killed and one was arrested. An officer was injured. Five weapons were seized. The gang members had suspectedly abducted and beat three people the previous day (coded separately). 3 fatalities, 1 injured.
On 3 May 2025, in the municipality of Madero, Michoacan de Ocampo (coded to Villa Madero), criminal groups clashed with each other. Casualties unknown.
On 3 May 2025, around El Habal, Sinaloa, there was an armed clash between armed individuals and military officers on the El Habal-La Noria road around Puerta de Canoas. Two armed men were killed. The armed individuals set a (narco) roadblock with a vehicle that was set on fire. 2 fatalities.
On 3 May 2025, in Siqueros, Sinaloa, there was an armed clash between military officers and armed individuals during a patrol. Two armed men were killed. Weapons were seized. 2 fatalities.
On 3 May 2025, around Mocorito, Sinaloa, there was an armed clash between armed individuals from a criminal group and the military forces in San Joaquin between Salvador Alvarado and Mocorito. One armed man was arrested. Some officers were injured after they were in a car accident. It is suspected that the arrested person is a regional leader for Los Mayitos Gang.
On 3 May 2025, in Texistepec, Veracruz, there was an armed clash between two groups of civilians at the facilities of a former mining unit. The event was sparked after a group of at least 100 people forcibly entered the former mining unit and attempted to take over the space. In the area, armed individuals were guarding the site, belonging to the Unidos Por Texistepec group. Shootings were made. One person was injured by gunfire, several others were also injured, and at least four people were reported missing. The event is related to a dispute over the allocation of land that formerly belonged to Petroleos Mexicanos (Pemex) between two leaders of civil associations, 'Unidos Por Texistepec.'
On 2 May 2025, in Ciudad de Mexico - Benito Juarez, one man opened fire at police officers who shot back and injured the man in Colonia Piedad Narvarte. The man crashed and then fled the scene when police officers attempted to stop the him. 1 injury.
Around 2 May 2025 (as reported), in San Luis Acatlan municipality, Puebla, a ministerial police officer was killed and his body was found inside a car on the San Luis-Marquelia highway near an area called Chinatla. 1 fatality.
On 2 May 2025, in Los Tanques, Sinaloa, armed rival groups engaged in an armed clash. During the clash, the armed groups set (narco) roadblocks at the entry of the community. There was a similar armed clash reported in the neighboring town Potrerillo del Norte (coded separately). Four people died in the two clashes reported in Elota. 4 fatalities split across two events.
On 2 May 2025, in Potrerillo del Norote, Sinaloa, armed rival groups engaged in an armed clash. During the clash, the armed groups set (narco) roadblocks at the entry of the community. There was a similar armed clash reported in the neighboring town Tanques (coded separately). Four people died in the two clashes reported in Elota. 4 fatalities split across two events.
On 2 May 2025, near Bonifacio Moreno, Michoacan de Ocampo, unknown armed individuals described as members of an organized crime cell attacked ministerial and state police officers. As a response, the armed individuals set fire to vehicles and set several (narco) roadblocks (coded separately). There were no casualties.
On 1 May 2025, in San Jose de Magdalena, Baja California Sur, rival factions of the Sinaloa Cartel (coded as Los CHapitos and Los Mayitos gangs) engaged in an armed clash at a ranch Pie de la Cuesta. Two people were found dead, one was burned inside a vehicle and another person inside a cistern. Three vehicles were found burned. 2 fatalities.
On 1 May 2025, in San Felipe, Baja California, one armed man suspected to be a member of La Chapiza (coded to Los Chapitos gang) shot at the state police who were on patrol in Colonia Ampliacion Tercera Seccion. The officers answered the attack. One officer was injured as a result and the armed man was arrested.
On 1 May 2025, near El Tepehuaje, Michoacan de Ocampo, armed individuals described as members of an organized criminal group opened fire at military officers who were on patrol on a dirt road. The officers shot back and killed one suspected criminal wearing tactical boots. Officers seized three stolen trucks, weapons, tactical vests, live magazines and cartridges. 1 fatality.
On 1 May 2025, in Chilpancingo de los Bravo, Guerrero, armed men described as members of a criminal group opened fire at officers of the National Guard and municipal police carrying out surveillance in Colonia Garita. The officers shot back and arrested one man. There were no casualties.
On 1 May 2025, in Ejido Santa Rosa, Tamaulipas, armed individuals opened fire at state police officers during a security operation. The officers answered the attack. One armed individual was killed and two were arrested. Police officers seized weapons, a truck and tactical vests. 1 fatality.
On 1 May 2025, close to Vallecillo, Nuevo Leon, unknown armed men opened fire at members of the State investigation agency's anti-kidnapping group police officers on the Monterrey-Laredo highway at the bus stop El Ranchito. The officers shot back and killed one of the men. One officer and one armed man were killed and another officer was injured. 2 fatalities, 1 injury.
On 1 May 2025, in Cosala municipality, Sinaloa, armed men engaged in armed clashes along the maxipista that connects Culiacan to Mazatlan. Residents reported gunshots heard and (narco) roadblocks, however it is unclear where exactly the clashes and the roadblocks took place. Casualties unknown.
On 1 May 2025, in Elota municipality, Sinaloa, armed men engaged in armed clashes along the maxipista that connects Culiacan to Mazatlan. Residents from Tanques, Potrerillos del Norote, Elota, Ceuta, Celestino Gasca and Abocho reported gunshots heard and (narco) roadblocks, however it is unclear where exactly the clashes and the roadblocks took place. Casualties unknown.
On 1 May 2025, in Culiacan municipality (coded to Culiacan Rosales), Sinaloa, armed men engaged in armed clashes along the maxipista that connects Culiacan to Mazatlan. Residents from Culiacancito reported gunshots heard and (narco) roadblocks, however it is unclear where exactly the clashes and the roadblocks took place. Casualties unknown.

### Summary of Key Developments: Explosions/Remote Violence in Mexico, May 2025

In May 2025, several incidents of explosions and remote violence were reported in Mexico, primarily in the states of Michoacán de Ocampo and Zacatecas. These events highlight ongoing security challenges and potential areas of conflict escalation.

- **Michoacán de Ocampo**: Multiple incidents occurred in this state, indicating a high level of unrest and organized criminal activity.
  - On 3 May, near Morelia, a grenade thrown by armed individuals injured a hunter who attempted to throw it back (MEX103730).
  - On 4 May, in Ichaqueo, a man was injured when a grenade he found exploded in his hand (MEX103729).
  - On 8 May, near Los Cuiniques, a drone was suspectedly used to launch an explosive, destroying a stolen taxi (MEX103721).
  - On the same day, around La Angostura, a landmine planted by the Jalisco New Generation Cartel (CJNG) injured several farmers traveling on a truck (MEX103743).

- **Zacatecas**: On 6 May, in Ojocaliente, unknown armed individuals threw homemade explosive devices at the police station, damaging the building and a patrol car (MEX103917).

These incidents underscore the persistent threat of organized crime and the need for enhanced security measures in these regions. The use of drones and landmines suggests an escalation in the tactics employed by criminal groups, requiring vigilant monitoring and proactive responses from law enforcement and security agencies.
simple_summary:
### Summary of Key Developments: Explosions/Remote Violence in Mexico, May 2025

In May 2025, several significant incidents of explosions and remote violence were reported in Mexico, primarily in the states of Michoacán and Zacatecas. These events highlight ongoing security challenges and potential escalations in conflict.

- **Michoacán de Ocampo**: On 8 May 2025, a drone was suspectedly used to launch an explosive that destroyed a stolen taxi near Los Cuiniques. The vehicle had been taken by armed men the previous day. Casualties remain unknown (Event ID: 1). On the same day, a landmine explosion near La Angostura injured several farmers traveling on a truck. The Jalisco New Generation Cartel (CJNG) is suspected of planting the mine (Event ID: 2). Earlier in the month, on 4 May, a man was injured by a grenade explosion in Ichaqueo (Event ID: 3). Around 3 May, a grenade thrown at hunters near Morelia injured one individual (Event ID: 4).

- **Zacatecas**: On 6 May 2025, unknown armed individuals on dirt bikes threw homemade explosives at the police station in Ojocaliente, damaging the building and a patrol car (Event ID: 5).

These incidents underscore the persistent threat of organized crime and the use of explosive devices in Mexico, with potential implications for public safety and security in the affected regions.

On 8 May 2025, around La Angostura, Michoacan de Ocampo, a landmine suspectedly planted by the Jalisco New Generation Cartel (CJNG) exploded and slightly injured a group of farmers who travelled on a truck. Several injured.
On 6 May 2025, in Ojocaliente, Zacatecas, according to witnesses, unknown armed individuals threw homemade explosive devices at the police station from dirt bikes. The building and a patrol car were damaged.

Around 3 May 2025, near Morelia, Michoacan de Ocampo, armed individuals threw a grenade at hunters near El Ranchito. One victim grabbed the grenade to throw it back but the device exploded and the man was injured as a result.

graphRAG_summary:
### Summary of Protests in Georgia, January 2025

Throughout January 2025, Georgia experienced a series of protests across multiple regions, primarily centered around political and social issues. Key developments include:

- **Support for Political Prisoners and Journalists**: Multiple protests were organized to demand the release of political prisoners and jailed journalists. Notable events include marches in Batumi City (GEO4862, GEO4868, GEO4871, GEO4875, GEO4880, GEO4884, GEO4888), Kutaisi City (GEO4885, GEO4886, GEO4889), and Tbilisi (GEO4861, GEO4864, GEO4869, GEO4873, GEO4877, GEO4881, GEO4887, GEO4890).

- **Pro-EU Sentiment**: Pro-EU protests were a significant feature, with rallies and marches occurring in Batumi City (GEO4871, GEO4875, GEO4878, GEO4880, GEO4884, GEO4888), Kutaisi City (GEO4872, GEO4885), Zugdidi City (GEO4874), and Tbilisi (GEO4861, GEO4869, GEO4877, GEO4881, GEO4887, GEO4890). These protests often included demands for new elections and the release of political prisoners.

- **Student and Public Servant Support**: Students and public servants organized protests to voice their support for political prisoners and to criticize government actions. Notably, students marched in Tbilisi (GEO4869, GEO4877, GEO4890), and public servants protested in Tbilisi (GEO4865).

- **Police and Government Interactions**: There were instances of police intervention, such as when protesters attempted to set up tents in Batumi City (GEO4880). Additionally, protests targeted government offices, including the City Hall in Tbilisi (GEO4865, GEO4883) and the Georgian Dream office (GEO4877).

- **Traffic Disruptions**: Protesters frequently blocked traffic on Rustaveli Avenue in Tbilisi, a major thoroughfare, to draw attention to their demands (GEO4869, GEO4873, GEO4877, GEO4881, GEO4887, GEO4890).

- **Specific Issues**: Protests also addressed specific issues such as police brutality (GEO4873), construction in the Hippodrome (GEO4870), and the safety norms neglected by the City Hall (GEO4883).

Overall, the protests in January 2025 highlighted widespread dissatisfaction with the government's actions, particularly regarding political prisoners, journalists, and pro-EU sentiments. The protests were largely peaceful, with no reported fatalities.
simple_summary:
### Summary of Protests in Georgia, January 2025

**Key Developments:**

1. **Pro-EU Protests and Political Prisoner Releases:**
   - Multiple pro-EU protests were organized across Georgia, particularly in Batumi, Kutaisi, and Tbilisi, demanding the release of political prisoners, including journalists and activists. (Events on 24, 25, 26, 27, 28, 29, 30, 31 January 2025)
   - Protesters in Batumi set up tents and faced police interference, leading to a skirmish. (29 January 2025)
   - In Tbilisi, protesters frequently blocked traffic on Rustaveli Avenue, a major thoroughfare. (24, 25, 26, 27, 28, 29, 30, 31 January 2025)

2. **Support for Arrested Journalists and Activists:**
   - Marches and rallies were organized to support arrested journalists and activists, with significant gatherings in front of key government buildings and media outlets. (24, 25, 26, 27, 28, 29, 30, 31 January 2025)
   - Journalists staged protests at the Mikheil Meskhi stadium and the prosecutor's office in Tbilisi. (29 January 2025)
   - In Gori, a protest was organized to support an activist who had been kidnapped and beaten. (27 January 2025)

3. **Student and Public Servant Protests:**
   - Students marched through Tbilisi streets demanding the release of political prisoners and gathered at various locations before converging on Rustaveli Avenue. (25, 27 January 2025)
   - Public servants with critical opinions about the government protested at City Hall in Tbilisi. (24 January 2025)

4. **Specific Issues and Locations:**
   - Protests in Kutaisi focused on the release of political prisoners and support for a jailed journalist. (24, 25, 26, 30, 31 January 2025)
   - In Zugdidi, a pro-EU protest was organized. (26 January 2025)
   - For Georgia organized a protest in Tbilisi, accusing City Hall of neglecting safety norms that led to a minor's death. (29 January 2025)

5. **Cultural and Local Issues:**
   - Musicians organized a concert and rally against construction in the former Hippodrome in Tbilisi. (25 January 2025)
   - Residents of Khulo organized a protest at the university building. (26 January 2025)

6. **Support for Former President:**
   - Supporters of former president Mikheil Saakashvili, members of the United National Movement, demanded his release in Batumi. (25 January 2025)

These protests highlight widespread dissatisfaction with the government's policies and actions, particularly concerning political prisoners, media freedom, and public safety. The frequent blocking of traffic and large-scale gatherings indicate a significant level of public unrest and potential for further escalation.

### Conflict-Early-Warning Brief: Violence Against Civilians in Georgia, January 2025

In January 2025, Georgia experienced a notable incident of violence against civilians. On January 26, 2025, in Shida Kartli, an activist in Gori City was kidnapped and beaten by unidentified individuals wearing masks. The activist believed the attack was linked to his involvement in recent protests (GEO4867). There were no reported fatalities in this incident.

### Conflict-Early-Warning Brief: Violence Against Civilians in Georgia, January 2025

**Summary of Key Developments:**

In January 2025, there was a notable incident of violence against civilians in Georgia. On 26 January 2025, an activist in Gori City was kidnapped and severely beaten by unidentified individuals wearing masks. The activist believed the attack was linked to his involvement in recent protests (Event ID: 20250126_GORI_001). This incident highlights a concerning trend of targeted violence against individuals engaged in civic activities, potentially indicating a broader pattern of intimidation and suppression of dissent. Further monitoring and analysis are recommended to assess the potential escalation of such incidents and their broader implications for civil liberties and public safety in Georgia.
